campaign.story:
Engage in power struggles and build your crew’s reputation. Salvage and steal to survive and endure a ruthless universe. And above all, do anything you can to get that next job.
This sci-fi tabletop roleplaying game takes you to the grimy blue-collar future of a universe filled with risk, but also opportunity. DEATH IN SPACE presents a vision of space where technology is broken and dirty, and society is harsh and desperate. The player characters make up a crew with their own spacecraft or station, and take on the jobs they can find, in order to earn some well-needed bucks and get ahead in the power struggles of the stellar system. 
The people making this game are Christian Plogfors and Carl Niblaeus of Stockholm Kartell. With this Kickstarter, we hope to get the funds to print the core book for the game, which should contain everything you need to start playing. We want to continue making material for the game after the game is out, in the form of adventures and other material to use in your game. 
Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or on the website. 

Here's a preview of what we hope the standard edition of the book will look like (the holographic foil is stretchgoal-dependent):
DEATH IN SPACE has its roots in the OSR scene, and follows similar design principles. In terms of setting and tone, inspiration comes primarily from the gritty science fiction of films like Outland and Prospect, classic westerns and the grimy future of early 80’s science fiction movies. 
It is a game about adventure and uncertain journeys out into the darkness of space, it is about you and your crew making a home of your spacecraft or station, in tough competition with everyone else, and most of all, it is about enduring in an abandoned frontier system where your only hope of surviving is to take any contract you can find, sometimes having to put your fate in your enemies' hands.
Inspiration
There are a lot of great and inspiring games out there. In terms of rules and approach, we have found inspiration in some form, large or small, in for example the following games (alphabetically listed): Coriolis, Into the Odd, Knave, Mothership, Mutant Year Zero, MÖRK BORG, Offworlders, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, Mutant  (1989 edition), Traveller. Out of these, MÖRK BORG, Knave and Coriolis deserve a special mention.
Most of the inspiration for the tone and feel comes from movies and series. Some of these, that have inspired elements of the setting in one way or another, are (alphabetically listed): 2001: A Space Odyssey, A Fistful of Dollars, Alien, Blade Runner, Escape from New York, The Expanse, Firefly, IO, Moon, Outland, Prospect, Sunshine, Total Recall, The Warriors. 
Visually, much of the inspiration comes from abstract geometric art and design, and old computer interfaces and manuals.

In terms of music, one of our stretchgoals consists of a dedicated soundtrack for the game, by our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon. You can already listen to a preview of what that will sound like on Spotify (or scroll down to the stretchgoal list and listen immediately). 


Standard edition with holographic foil (not final)
Kickstarter exclusive edition (not final)
Our main goal is to print a durable book of excellent quality that is easy to use at the table. We aim for an offset printed book with a sewn binding and possibly some fancy extras, depending on which stretchgoals are funded.
The book should land at about 128 pages and measure 6 by 9 inches. You can choose from two cover versions: the standard cover, and a special edition, only available in the Kickstarter.
Regarding the covers, we plan for the special edition to be a cloth bound book, and the regular edition cover to be embellished with holographic foil (the silvery kind with reflecting colors), if we fund the corresponding stretchgoal (otherwise, the holographic parts will be a solid color). Apart from that, there are more possible upgrades to the book in stretchgoals. Basically, we don’t want to pull any punches, and will try to make this as nice a book as possible.
Contentwise, the core rulebook contains everything you need to start playing immediately:
 Light-weight rules, intended to be easy to use and quick to learn
  A system for quickly generating player characters and their spacecraft or space-station
   60+ different modules to make the spacecraft or space-station your own
  An introduction to the default setting, the Tenebris stellar system, its main locations and history (with many pieces of the puzzle left for you to fill in)
  A system for repairs, where you collect spare parts to repair your stuff
   20 cosmic mutations, representing physical manifestations of the void through your body
  A system for spacecraft confrontations and boarding
  An introductory scenario to jumpstart your campaign
   40+ tables and generators packed with setting flavor
Below are some preliminary spreads to give you a flavor of how the interior of the book will look like:
The rules of DEATH IN SPACE are intended to be easy to use and hack but also to support and introduce the setting through the rules. While inspired by OSR games, the primary intent is not to be fully compatible with the rulesets and modules of old, but rather to try to capture the quickness and simplicity of these rulesets, tweak them according to our preferences and add some setting flavor (however, the rules are still close enough to other OSR rulesets that material should be possible to use with some simple conversions).
The basic rule when you try to accomplish something, say force open an airlock, or resist the effects of strange radiation, is to roll a d20 modified by one of four ability values, the ability determined by the nature of the task. If you roll over a fixed difficulty, you succeed. Failing checks gives you void points that you can use to increase your chances the next time you attempt something. Beware of saving up too many though, that might result in some nasty consequences. Void points are also used to activate cosmic mutations, strange powers from the void. 
The player characters are all part of a crew with their own spacecraft or space-station, their sanctuary in a dangerous universe. Characters are generated in a quick randomized fashion, making it quick to make a new one when (not if)  your character suffers an accident. With a list of 60+ modules that provide new possibilities, the players can successively customize their ship or station and really make it their home and base of their adventures. If your ship or gear should break, you can repair it as soon as you collect the necessary spare parts. In case you encounter rivals on your travels, the rules for spacecraft confrontations determine the outcome and whether you can avoid being boarded.
DEATH IN SPACE focuses on the Tenebris system—a system of planets and objects revolving around the star Tenebris. It is a stellar system ravaged by war and strife, where a greed-fueled mining for precious gems ended in a conflict that laid waste to the intricate trade networks that ensured technological production. With no new parts to find, almost every single object built today, from weapon to spacecraft, is put together from discarded, salvaged or stolen parts. Nothing is new.
As if rebuilding the system after the war was not enough, there are reports from stargazing cosmologists that the universe has stopped expanding, and that it has instead begun collapsing at an accelerating rate. The news that civilization is at its end have created a sense of hopelessness and disorder, and in many sectors of the system former vassals have taken this chance to seize control from distant rulers.
Player spacecraft concept by Mattias Astenvald
In the heart of the Tenebris system is the Iron Ring—a huge, ring-like structure surrounding the moon Inauro like a belt of metal. This is the center of activity in the Tenebris system, and here miners and salvagers huddle in cramped living quarters, waiting for their next contract and a chance to earn some much needed money. In other parts of the Ring, far from the bustling market-places and common areas, there are dark, empty sectors, where shady types hide from attention.
Among the people of the Iron Ring, cryptic rumors are spreading about a void accelerating the collapse. A void that whispers strange sentences to the unlucky through the ever present thick static noise that grows stronger and stronger as you travel towards the edge of civilization. A void that infects and corrupts and imbues their bodies with odd powers.
In the middle of all this are the player characters: hard-working explorers and laborers hoping for a big score.
The 99% Void Safe reward level
Void protection. With this reward level you get the core book in print, with the cover of your choice (regular or special edition). The book will be wrapped in foil, to keep it safe from the strange void radiation. Better safe than sorry. 
This is a mockup and not the final product.
T-shirt. Premium cotton t-shirt from Spreadshirt. We're aiming for a design based on the book cover.
Handouts. Two maps for the adventure in the core book—Welcome to the Ring—printed on high quality paper. 
Stickers. One prismatic sticker portraying the spacecraft by Mattias Astenvald, and one holographic sticker using the graphics from the standard cover. These designs are exclusive for the Kickstarter. Below are preliminary designs.
Setting location and printed note. We create a location connected to the Iron Ring—an establishment, a station, spacecraft or similar—and dedicate it to you. The locations are planned to be included in a table in the book. You get an individually crafted and printed thank-you letter that also includes the location name and description. 
50000 SEK – We make this book 
A high-quality offset printed 128-page book including all you need to start playing.
75000 SEK – Holographic foil cover
We add holographic foil to the regular book cover and make this book glimmer.
100000 SEK – Soundtrack
We ask our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon to make a full-length soundtrack for DEATH IN SPACE, that you can use as background music for your games. Every backer gets the soundtrack digitally, and it will also be made available on Spotify and Bandcamp. Here is how Helium Kid Kanon describes the soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE:
"Sound waves from dark, vibrating aegrine were found on a 570 million year old, volcanic island. When passed through a cloud chamber, they turn into an oozing, analog warmth, layered with sparkles of cosmic noise. These are some of the parts, arranged into a multi layered space. A composition that can trigger chronesthesia. The soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE."
 150000 SEK – Pamphlet adventure
We make a pamphlet adventure. All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver.
200000 SEK – More illustrations
We add more spacecraft illustrations by artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
250000 SEK – Map poster
We make a map poster of the Tenebris system. For the map, we will receive some help from graphic designer and animator Gabriel Herrin. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect – one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE – so we are very happy to have him onboard! All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver. Note that logos are placeholders and will be replaced.
300000 SEK – Bookmark ribbon 
We add a bookmark ribbon to the book, to make it easier to find the page you’re always flipping to.   
350000 SEK – More illustrations
We add even more spacecraft illustrations by our artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
500000 SEK – New adventure
We ask Rickard Antroia to write an adventure for us. The adventure will be released in pdf and all backers get it digitally. Rickard is a writer and designer who has written adventures for Coriolis and Tales from the Loop and worked with editing on Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood, Vaesen and Alien RPG. He wants to take you on an epic journey to the edge of the universe.
700000 SEK – Cults and factions
Pelle Nilsson - from Ockult Örtmästare Games, author of games such as MÖRK BORG and Barkhäxan among others, contributes to the game by providing a number of cults or factions of the Tenebris system that you can use in your game.

800000 SEK – Online generator 
We ask Karl Druid to make an online character generator for us. Karl writes material and makes virtual paraphernalia for tabletop RPGs. He is for example behind the MÖRK BORG online generators scvmbirther and dngngen.  

900000 SEK – Printed pamphlet #2 
We print the adventure pamphlet by Rickard Antroia from the 500k stretch goal. All backers with physical reward levels get it (all reward levels except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver). This means that if you get the printed book, you get two different printed adventure pamphlets with it.

1,100,000 SEK – Solar Fields song and Tenebris system soundscape
Magnus Birgersson, also known under the name Solar Fields, will write and produce a track inspired by the material included in the book! Solar Fields has released 17 albums and appeared in over 60 compilations, including the in-game scores for the computer games Mirror's Edge and Mirror's Edge Catalyst. You can find his music on Spotify and on other platforms.   
In addition, if we pass this stretchgoal, Helium Kid Kanon will create a number of immersive soundscapes that represent various locations and environments in the Tenebris system. A perfect background to amplify your experience while exploring our world.  
The songs for the soundtrack and the soundscapes will be published on streaming platforms like Spotify, and backers get them digitally.
The majority of the money we collect will fund the printing cost for the book and any other funded print material. The remaining funds will be used to pay our collaborators for their work and costs. 
DEATH IN SPACE will be published by Free League Workshop, Free League Publishing's sublabel for externally designed games. They are responsible for shipping and distribution.
We plan to use a pledge manager, and charge shipping separately after the campaign has ended. See the map for our current best estimates of shipping costs*. The current plan is to ship the game from the UK as the default, but with distribution hubs in the EU and US as well. 
* This is based on shipping one book, the map and a pamphlet, and the Moon Outlaw and 99% Void Safe reward levels may therefore incur some extra shipping charges

Christian Plogfors. When he is not writing for DEATH IN SPACE, Christian spends the rest of his time on the layout and graphics for the game. He has been designing worlds for computer games for 18 years, now as a senior level designer, and has contributed to games such as Battlefield, Mirror’s Edge and Star Wars Battlefront. When relaxing, he likes to write material for his Into the Odd hack Into the Jungle. He has also contributed with material and layout for the Night Yeast zine.
Carl Niblaeus. While almost every sentence of the game has been dissected by both Carl and Christian, Carl has had the last word on much of the language in the book. In the RPG world, Carl has contributed to MÖRK BORG zine Feretory, the Night Yeast zine, and released one or two old school modules before that. He also helps running the so-called Old School Corner (“Old School-hörnan”) at GothCon, Sweden’s largest RPG con. There he referees his own and others’ creations. Outside of RPGs, Carl has a PhD in astroparticle physics, and has spent many years researching the underpinnings of our own universe. In DEATH IN SPACE, this knowledge is used to inspire the creation of another.
Collaborators
Apart from us there are a number of collaborators who provide invaluable assistance in making the game.
Johan Nohr. As one half of the team behind MÖRK BORG, Johan should be well-known to many in our audience. With MÖRK BORG, he works tirelessly to make it look as great as it does, and we are very happy to have him onboard. In DEATH IN SPACE, Johan has worked with the illustrations, adding touches to give them a more personal feel.
Mattias Astenvald. Mattias is an artist located in Uppsala, Sweden, working in the digital gaming industry. For our game, he helps make reality of our spacecraft and we hope to make use of his great skills as much as we can. 
Gabriel Herrin. Seattle-based graphic designer and animator. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect, which is one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE, so we're really happy have him onboard. He will help us make company logos for the map poster. Check out more of his stuff here.
Stockholm Kartell is a creative coven of writers, designers and idiots. A group of friends who play and sometimes make games together.

https://www.deathinspace.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first Kickstarter as creators, we have the experience of Free League and the rest of Stockholm Kartell to help us make this project a reality. The game content is at the launch of the campaign about 90% complete, and we foresee no major changes after the campaign. After the campaign we want to spend about 2 months finalising the last few details before doing a proper round of editing and proofreading with a native English speaker. Our plan is then to deliver the game to the printer in September, which should provide enough time for the game to be in your hands by January 2022. 

Given the experience of Free League Publishing, we feel confident that printing, stocking and shipping will be in safe hands, and we will do our utmost to make sure that you will have your books by January! However, unforeseen things can always happen, and we will make sure to communicate any such delays or issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pledgemanager is live + update from the studio
updates.update_content:
Wow, just wow! We are truly blown away by the huge level of support this campaign ended up with. THANK YOU! Thank you all so much for believing in this game that means so much for us.
We are now really excited to finish the last parts and get this game into your hands. We have tried hard to make a game that we want to experience and play ourselves, and now all of you have become a part of that. Thanks to your great support, we now have the possibility to make the game we wanted to make, and for this we are enormously grateful. And soon, it is your game too.

Alright, three days left now! Let’s keep our fingers crossed that we can clear that stretchgoal at 1.1M SEK!
We’ve had some questions about mechanics, and in this update we’ll go through the mechanics in a bit more detail, as they look now. Note that the rules are not completely finalized yet, and we’re still doing some playtesting, so some of what we write in this post may change. Most of it should remain about the same though.

Time for a short update. 
First something on stretchgoals: We have unlocked a second printed pamphlet! With that, we will now include a total of three adventures with the game—two pamphlets and one in the book.

We have also added a new stretchgoal. For us, music is a big part of playing and writing Death in Space, and if we pass this stretchgoal, we will get a soundscape by Helium Kid Kanon that represents various environments and locations of the Tenebris system. In addition, this stretchgoal includes a track written especially for the game by the musician Magnus Birgersson, also known as Solar Fields. Solar Fields is an experienced musician who has released 17 albums and appears on 60 compilations, so we couldn't be more excited to hear what he will create.

Alright, time for an update! We’ve been a little quiet for a few days, but in case you haven’t noticed, we have cleared a couple of stretchgoals since our last update, and added a couple of new ones. In Sweden we have had some days off for Easter, and it’s been good to have some time to think about the route ahead and to start working on content for the game again.
Let’s talk about what we have cleared:

updates.update_userinfo: Sounds, music and screaming into space
updates.update_content:
We're still not sure whether we've landed on our feet yet after yesterday, but we are incredibly grateful for the support. With 500k SEK in funding, we just cleared a stretchgoal for an adventure (in pdf) by Rickard Antroia. This will be the third adventure included. 

Rickard is the main designer behind the recently released campaign module The Last Cyclade for the Coriolis RPG and has been involved in other games such as Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood and Vaesen. He likes to write about mysterious phenomena, rickety tech, fights for survival and conflicts where it is hard to choose a side.

Wow, we really smashed through those stretchgoals faster than light speed. As of now, we have already unlocked the bookmark ribbon and secured funding for more illustrations by Mattias Astenvald. And of course, we have unlocked both the pamphlet and map, both included in print for rewards which include physical stretchgoals.
For the map, we'll get some assistance by Gabriel Herrin, a graphic designer and animator who worked on the movie Prospect. We're really happy about this, given that Prospect has been a great source of inspiration when making the game!

Wow, incredible, that was faster than we could ever imagine! Thank you all so much for believing in the project that we feel so strongly for, and helping it become reality!
We are still trying to keep track of everything that’s happening, but we did have a couple of stretchgoals planned (we were not really prepared to list them so soon though). It’s going to be a long night.
Thank you!

campaign.story:
This is a Kickstarter for a zine full of MÖRK BORG stuff. Most of it is created by our wonderful community and will be (or already is) made available for free download on morkborg.com, but there is also exclusive official material.
In this Kickstarter is also the official MÖRK BORG GM screen, and a box full of almost-forgotten gods. 

✖ Thank you Terra Tenebrosa for letting us use the track The Arc of Descent from the album The Tunnels in the Kickstarter video. If you're looking for feverous, experimental black/post-metal, check it out here. 
This is what this godless tome will look like
Punish your ears
To get into the proper mood, we created this Spotify playlist. Put it on while reading this Kickstarter, and/or when playing MÖRK BORG.
✖ MÖRK BORG is a blackened artpunk doomsday RPG about miserable bastards and heretics enduring a bleak, dying world. It's a doom metal album of a game. A spiked flail to the face. Rules light, heavy everything else. It's made by Pelle Nilsson of Ockult Örtmästare Games and Johan Nohr from Stockholm Kartell, and published by Free League Publishing. Check it out here, you might like it.
Some people said this

✖ MÖRK BORG CULT (MBC) is our sub-label for selected, approved and curated MÖRK BORG content by the community. Basically, you send us homebrew stuff and if we like it and it follows our guidelines, we make some edits, art and lay it out before publishing it for free download on morkborg.com. Digital MBC content (including that of zines like this) will always be free, but this is a chance to get some of it in high-quality print form. I mean, you can download the content for free and print it at home too if you want. 
✖ Since a few days ago, we are also putting the submissions to MBC on pause. When we started this project we had NO IDEA we would receive as much content as we are, and since we're also working on forthcoming books etc, we simply can't keep up with the demand. So we close it down for a bit, until we've cleared the backlog, at which point we can open it up again.  

✖ About six months ago we Kickstarted MÖRK BORG CULT: FERETORY, the first MBC zine. It was a much bigger success than we could have imagined and an unbelievable 1792 backers helped us realize the project. Since then we have received a TON of awesome content submitted to the Cult and we want to collect it into a physical zine once more. So, if you're familiar with MBC: FERETORY, you know the drill. This is pretty much the exact same thing. Oh, and there's also the Official MÖRK BORG Game Master's Screen of Doom and the mysterious shrine IKHON. We'll get to that. 
MÖRK BORG CULT: HERETIC is published by Free League Publishing, same as MÖRK BORG and MÖRK BORG CULT: FERETORY was. They will handle printing, distribution and digital fulfillment.
  All these either are or will be available for free download on morkborg.com
 Adventure: Graves Left Wanting. The PCs find themselves buried alive in the vast, ever-changing cemetery of Graven-Tosk. This dark and weird tombcrawl is suitable as a campaign starter or a post-TPK adventure. By Karl Druid 
 Adventure: Sepulchre of the Swamp Witch. In a hidden repository deep in the Slithering Swamp is a witch's altar of glyph-covered roots. They say it can fulfill any wish. Could stopping the approaching Doom be within its powers? Only one way to find out. By Christian Sahlén. 
 Adventure: Bloat. Villagers disappear. Tracks lead to an underground temple of bacchanalian frenzy, reeking of rot, offal and bile. Find them and sate your hunger. By Greg Saunders. 
 Rules: Unheroic Feats. Enhance and personalize your classless characters with these optional advancement rules. By Johnny Carhat. 
 Class: Sacrilegious Songbird. You struck a deal with a devil and since that woeful day your soul screams but your throat sings sweetly. And so does your purse. A small price to pay. By Karl Druid. 
 Class: Shedding Vicar. Armor is weak, clothes a sin and your very skin an abhorrent vanity. Best to remove it all and walk peeled, clean and glistening wet into the night. By Cameron James. 
 Creature: The Merchant. Cursed with eternal life and destined to roam the world trading shards of souls for ruinous relics. You never know when this mysterious monger might appear. Will you make a deal? By Johnny Carhat. 
 Creature: The Bone Bowyer. This horrid fey lurks in the tangled depths of Sarkash where it fashions heart-seeking bone bows and blood-dyed cloaks from the flesh of the lost. By Matthew Bottiglieri. 
 Rules: Blackpowder Weapons for the Rich and Foolhardy. The world is ending, so let's end it with a BANG. These optional rules are the spark that adds fire- to your fights. Whether it's a pepperbox or a ribauldequin, you can be assured these things are loud and deadly. By Ian McClung. 

These are exclusive to the zine and will not be made available for free download. These will not only be included in the printed zine, but will also come translated to Swedish as a digital appendix to the PDF version. 
 Creature: Borg Bitor. Vile, insectoid, parasitic creatures creeping into houses and nurseries come nighttime. There is a baby. There is an egg. Don't let them become one.
 Creature: Rotting Nurse. Many a Galgenbeckian remembers Mikol's infirmary and its gruesome experiments exposed by the inquisition. The head surgeon was jailed but whatever really happened to his accomplices, the nurses? Their lengthy, cruel punishment and vivisepulture. The empty graves. The shimmer from the starless skies. The many-legged horses carrying the bodies away... for what purpose?  
 250.000 SEK STRETCH GOAL Adventure: Nurse the Rot. As you put Mother Marathuk—the aunt of one of you dregs—to her final rest, the village Tunstal is set in complete darkness, leaving it to its doom unless something is done. 
 Rules: Curses and Cures. So you opened the puzzle box, whistled in the old mine or carelessly removed the protecting wards? These curses will be the consequence. Luckily, there are ways to break them, but it comes at a cost. 

✖ Our goal is to make this zine similar to MÖRK BORG CULT: FERETORY, meaning something quite different from the MÖRK BORG  core book. This is a rough zine, a haphazardly composited collection of ideas and articles, and we want it to feel like something you'd pick up at a concert or an underground art fair. It'll be a soft-cover zine, about 60-ish A5 pages thick, printed on heavily textured uncoated paper in 7 colors (CMYK+3), with some extra things metallic foiling and golden staples or who knows? You know, a typical zine.
The zine will only be printed in English, but the things written by Pelle and Johan will be included in Swedish in a digital Appendix.

 Introducing: The MÖRK BORG Screen of Doom* 
*not really the name. OR IS IT?
✖ Since the release of MÖRK BORG we have seen quite a few awesome custom-made GM screens made, and now we want to offer you guys our take on it. This will be a beast of a screen; small but versatile. 
A five-paneled A5 portrait wall of death 
Printed with gold metallic ink on one side and vivid neon yellow on the other. We want the screen to scream in your face when you run the game. 
Should we reach the 325.000 SEK stretch goal, we'll even equip each screen with two pairs of photo corners (for lack of a better name) that can hold A5 sheets with whatever tables or notes you want. So that you don't have to use that sharpie on the screen (I mean you still can, but you don't have to). Think old-school photo album, but for your adventure notes.
 Available in both English and Swedish. You pick the language you want in a post-Kickstarter Pledge Manager.

The back has a ton of more or less useful tables. If we reach the Stretch goal you can even change two of the panels to have whatever reference tables, adventure notes and/or profane poetry you prefer.
 The front is all art, five scenes of various locales and important characters in the Dying world, from SHE in the mountains of Bergen Chrypt to the endless graveyard Graven-Tosk beneath the Shadowking's palace. 
 The GM-facing side sports a wide array of tables and rules summaries that might come in handy during play, such as an NPC generator, equipment and Powers, combat summary (with an optional hit location table), generic enemy stat-blocks and a d100 list of random junk you can find when looting the cultists' coffers (previously printed in MBC: FERETORY and available on morkborg.com). 


One more thing
Forged by the left hand of Nechrubel, bound in cured skin and soot-black wood, the ancient god-vessels known as IKHONs are detested by the Two-Headed Basilisks. Wielding their Powers, unfettering the Profane Profound shackled within is a serious heretical crime and whoever may carry these blackened shrines will be forever hunted by the inquisition. But perhaps it is worth it. 
Early mockup. Might change. You never know with these things.
✖ IKHON is a mysterious box. A gaol keeping four almost-forgotten folk gods at bay; the Bilkherd, the Becklure, the Old Dead and the dreaded Silkfiend.  Those who dare commune with them are promised great rewards. But life and death go hand in hand and too small a sacrifice could be perceived as an insult. This gift could very well be a curse. IKHON is an
 a6 box with rules on how to unfetter the Profane Profound. While you can never choose which one to summon and how they'll react, (willing) human sacrifice will tip the odds slightly in your favor. Within are
 four tracts, one for each god-creature, detailing their gifts and punishments. Each a 24 page A6 booklet. 
 Available in both English and Swedish. You pick the language you want in a post-Kickstarter Pledge Manager.
Written by Pelle Nilsson but torn apart and rebuilt in a stranger, darker form by Fiona Maeve Geist and Jarrett Crader of the MoonRat Conspiracy.  
 Over 40 full-page illustrations by the masterful Paraguayan artist Samuel Araya, whose oil paintings will bring the Profane Profound to blasphemous life. This is but one of them, giving you an idea of the kind of aesthetic this thing will have:
One of these mysterious, bene/malevolent deities.

Pledge levels and what they include
We got some stretch goals, in case we should get more funds than we need to just make the zine, screen and IKHON happen:
 100.000 SEK We make this thing, simple as that.
 175.000 SEK No zine is complete without silver foil details! If we hit this Stretch Goal we'll add a bit of shine to one of the pages.
 250.000 SEK  We include the official and zine exclusive adventure Nurse the Rot (check the Stuff by Pelle and Johan section above for more details). 
  325.000 SEK We equip the GM screen with two pairs of photo corners allowing you to customize it with your own reference sheets for whatever you're running (just print and cut it to roughly A5 size and you're good!). 
 400.000 SEK We'll make two of these additional GM screen reference sheets and have them printed and included with the screen. Exactly what they'll have on them will be revealed.
 825.000 SEK We print a minimalistic dungeon crawl in the form of a one-page comic, made by Łukasz Kowalczuk. It will be in A2 format (and also PDF) and comes with the zine. 
 900.000 SEK Pelle will make a generator that will let you generate sects, cults, their leaders and beliefs. This will take up one spread in the zine.
 1.000.000 SEK, the final stretch goal: We turn the Monster Generator from MÖRK BORG CULT: FERETORY into a digital app, just like we did with scvmbirther and dngngen.  
✖ Of course, if you want to supercharge your pledge with additional things you'll be able to tack on these (more or less) family-friendly products after the Kickstarter campaign ends. These will be shipped together with the MBC: Heretic items. 
✖ To buy an addon, click the "Manage My Pledge" button and increase your pledge manually with the total cost (in SEK) for all the addons you want. After the Kickstarter ends, there will be a Pledge Manager where you can mark which addons you want for the extra money you put it.
✖ You can also leave your pledge unchanged and add things after the Kickstarter ends.
Note that addons can incur additional shipping fees as the weight increases, paid for in the pledge manager.

MÖRK BORG CORE BOOK, 250 SEK
✖ The actual game that all this is for. Maybe you want to start your perilous MÖRK BORG journey here and thus need the actual rule book, or something happened to your old copy. Either way, you can get it here! Includes a PDF. 

 MÖRK BORG CULT: FERETORY, 150 SEK 
✖ The previous MÖRK BORG CULT zine, with lots of adventures, monsters, treasures and untimely demise including the mini/solo game Dark Fort which was the original game that later evolved into MÖRK BORG. Includes a PDF. 

DEATH TEMPLE SZTUN, 50 SEK
✖ A hyper-linear murder gauntlet of a dungeon crawl. Short (a folded A4 pamphlet, so 6 pages) but sweet (actually not sweet, more bitter and rank). Does not include a PDF.
Character sheet pads, 60 SEK
✖ A pad of character sheets printed on uncoated paper, perfect for writing on or to angrily crumple into a pathetic ball of disappointment. Does not include a PDF but the character sheets are available for free download on morkborg.com so there's no need.
Extra copy of MÖRK BORG CULT: HERETIC, 150 SEK
✖ Add a second copy of this zine to your pledge. Give it to a friend. Cut it to pieces. Or just keep one close at hand in case something happens. These are weird times. Includes a PDF.
IKHON, 180 SEK
✖ We don't recommend it, but perhaps you want to obtain this mystical box and have a peek inside. In that case, you can add one to your pledge. Includes a PDF.
MÖRK BORG GM Screen, 180 SEK
✖ Add a GM screen to your pledge. Includes a PDF. No witty text here, sorry.

Shipping
These are weird times. Not only because of covid-19 and the uncertainty it brings but also with Brexit screwing international shipping up in unclear ways. Luckily we are able to ship from a Germany-based warehouse and a US-based instead of the UK this time around, but the current situation will, unfortunately, lead to increased shipping costs and possible delays beyond our control. We have done what we can but at the end of the day, some of these things are outside of even our unholy grasp. 

Shipping will be added in a Pledge Manager after the Kickstarter campaign ends and will be based on the number of products you add to your pledge. But these are the estimates for the pledge levels as they are in this Kickstarter: 
Additional costs like taxes and/or customs could, but should not, apply.

✖ Due to COVID-19 there is a possibility that American backers will receive their stuff a month later than European backers, meaning it might arrive in August. We are doing what we can to avoid this but can't make any promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are experienced in running successful Kickstarter campaigns and to lower the risks on this one, the majority of the stuff we're offering is already done. The zine is written and most of it is proofread, most of the art is done. The screen is pretty much ready to send to print and Ikhon is well underway. We're in good, reliable hands with Free League Publishing when it comes to fulfillment and distribution, and we will keep you guys posted on any news and updates during and after the campaign. 

The two things that cause uncertainty are Covid-19 and Brexit. The former could possibly affect both our production and the distribution should anything happen, and the latter could, in the worst case, make shipping way more expensive than we initially budgeted for but right now we're running with the latest numbers and estimates from the distributor and have a buffer to take from should things go to shit.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
As with all MÖRK BORG stuff we're focusing on top quality printing and materials, to make sure your books and products don't fall apart. You shouldn't ever have to buy another copy unless it catches fire or anything.
Reusability and recyclability
This is not just a collector's item that will remain on your shelf (or even better, on the game table) for ages, we recommend that you give your used book away to a friend or enemy that you really want to see getting into this kind of game. Might do them some good. Or not.

campaign.story:
The Southlands feature high adventure in a self-contained and standalone campaign setting, with all the tools at your fingertips for a dozen adventures and even full campaigns! This updated 5E version includes new player options, an updated Worldbook with all-new chapters, and a fantastical city book to launch a memorable campaign—and a caravan's weight in short- and medium-length adventures. The Southlands setting is fully compatible with the 5th Edition of the world’s first RPG.
Welcome friend! Come and adventure with us here.
The project will create more than a dozen main rewards covering 4 major formats with two partner companies:
A hardcover Southlands Worldbook in both regular and limited editions, described in this Table of Contents preview 
A hand-tooled, rich leather edition of the Worldbook, 
A hardcover City of Cats, a home base containing many adventures,
A softcover Southlands Player's Guide of heroic options, subclasses, and races, described in this preview and developer's diary 
The fully-optimized PDFs for all of the above,
 Digital Roll20 editions of the Southlands Worldbook, City of Cats, and Player's Guide for that virtual tabletop (VTT), published by our partners at Roll20, and
The Fantasy Grounds editions of the Southlands Worldbook, City of Cats, and the Player's Guide for that VTT platform, published by our partners at Smiteworks.
Kobold Press will also produce the Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover edition of Tales Beneath the Sands, a collection of adventures by Jerry LeNeave (preview).
Special Editions
The limited edition will be printed once with a leatherette, foil-stamped cover, ribbon bookmark, special endpapers, and similar touches. The content is identical to the regular edition, but this deluxe, limited edition often becomes extremely sought after.
This project does also offer a handbound leather edition for collectors and bibliophiles. This is done entirely in the traditional style of bookbinding, with excellent leather (possibly deep green or sky blue) stamped with gold foil and embellished with corded spine, ribbon bookmarks, and other flourishes. This is limited to roughly a dozen copies and is not available after the Kickstarter. Because of the extra time needed to create it, this reward ships about a month after the other reward packages do.
Bundles
You can get the Southlands materials separately or in bundles of 3 items, and the bundles offer a discount. In addition, the limited edition is available only though the Kickstarter, not through later elements such as a survey or pledge manager. (Sometimes we have a few extra limited editions for sale in the Kobold Store—that's never guaranteed!).
 Bonus Goals & Level Up Items 
Up to 10 of the PDF rewards for backing the Southlands come as standalone stretch goal items. These include both new and existing adventures set in the Southlands, for levels 1 to 10, as well as expanded takes on Southlands magic and groups such as the Emerald Order. These PDF rewards are included for everyone who backs at the $25 reward level or higher, and you can see them marked in the Stretch Goal graphics with the "Bonus Goal!" icon. Depending on how many are ultimately unlocked, some will be delivered in January and February; others will come later. 
The various rewards and bundles are described and listed to the right, and shown in the chart below. In addition, this project has been selected for the Kickstarter Add-Ons Beta (see below). After you choose your main pledge, you'll be presented with the option to add additional items in whatever combination works best for you.
Note that there will be no pledge management step for this project; it is not possible to pledge $1 now and add on rewards later. A print preorder may be made available through the Kobold Press store for late backers. Surveys requesting your address will come from Kickstarter.
This project has been selected by the Kickstarter team for Kickstarter's Beta Add-Ons feature. This is a new element for Kickstarter that we used to handle in a separate pledge manager, but for the Southlands, add-ons are now included in the Kickstarter campaign directly.
Add-ons make it easy to add items to your pledge during the Kickstarter campaign when you want to mix and match. (For example, if you want the Limited Edition package of all 3 books, but you also want a second copy of the Player's Guide softcover and all the Roll20 licenses, you will have the option to add that second copy and the Roll20 bundle as add-ons to your Limited Edition package after you select your pledge level.)

 Kickstarter Exclusive
In particular, the Tales Beneath the Sands adventure collection is a Kickstarter print exclusive that is available only as an add-on here (PDF and VTT will be available more generally—the print exclusive version is a collector's item). Tales Beneath the Sands collects three adventures into a hardcover trilogy with new art and maps, for a full tomb-centric adventure series in the Southlands. It covers levels 2 to 5 of play, and makes a perfect complement of tomb-crawling to match the urban, treacherous, and roguish adventures in City of Cats.
We'll have more information about Add-Ons in the FAQ and are grateful to be part of Kickstarter's new experiment in Add-Ons.
This project continues the Kobold Press goal of reducing shipping costs to international backers and shipping in a sustainable way by using friendly, bulk shipments to three main regions outside the United States: Canada, Australia/NZ, and the UK. From there, physical shipments go to backers via Canada Post, Australia Post, and Royal Mail.
GLOBAL SHIPMENTS: Because of the difficulties we encountered getting Tome of Beasts 2 to backers in a timely way and the increasing costs of international shipping, we're shrinking our printed reward distribution. The Southlands Worldbook, Player's Guide, and City of Cats PDFs and VTTs are all available worldwide; unfortunately, the printed books are not available as part of the Kickstarter in Europe and countries other than on those on the list above. Printed books will be available via local retailers instead. 
We hope to remedy this situation in future projects. For now, we simply can't provide effective shipping without a high degree of risk in both schedule and cost.
As always with our projects, if the Southlands project exceeds its funding goal we will expand several elements. The more people who support the Southlands, the better the rewards are for everyone!
In particular, we will add up to 10 adventure and player option PDFs to the rewards for all backers at the $25 level and up. These goals are marked with the Bonus Goal icon in the stretch goal list, because each adds another standalone title to the reward items.
That's the last of our stretch goals, as this project has exceeded expectations in every way. A massive thank you to everyone who has supported the 5th Edition Southlands!

At Kobold Press, a fantastic team of accomplished tabletop gaming professionals is working hard to pull this project together.
In addition to the folks listed below, it is very important to us at Kobold Press to involve voices that represent the real-world cultures from which the Southlands draw influence. To make sure we do this project right, we've involved creators who trace their descent to those regions, and as all of the text and art nears completion and the stretch goals are incorporated, we'll continue to employ these diverse creators as well as cultural consultants every step of the way. Please see our FAQ for more information about this important topic.
Richard Green, Worldbook Lead Designer: Richard Green has been in love with tabletop roleplaying games since 1980. An early contributor to Open Design, he's been writing for Kobold Press for over ten years. He was the lead designer on Empire of the Ghouls, and his credits include the Midgard Worldbook, Midgard Heroes Handbook, and Midgard Bestiary. Six years ago, he wrote and published Parsantium: City at the Crossroads, a fantasy city sourcebook based on his long-running campaign. He has also designed for D&D Adventurers League and Raging Swan Press. Richard lives in London with his wife Kate and two cats.
Kim Mohan, Worldbook Lead Editor: Kim Mohan is an editor and writer whose work on D&D dates back over four decades, beginning in 1980 when he joined the staff of Dragon magazine. After seven years as the magazine’s editor, he went on to fill other roles for TSR Inc., and Wizards of the Coast, including managing editor of RPG R&D and a stint as editor of Amazing Stories. He is the author of the Wilderness Survival Guide, one of the original D&D hardcover rule books. Officially retired from Wizards of the Coast since 2013, he continues to work as an editing mercenary for any company that will have him.
Anna B. Meyer, Worldbook Lead Cartographer: Anna B. Meyer is a professional fantasy cartographer specializing in visualizing worlds using the latest digital tools and an artistic eye. Her goal is to create maps and images that inspire and guide Game Masters and players to experience a world in ways beyond what words and traditional fantasy maps alone can accomplish. She started pursing fantasy cartography as a hobby over 20 years ago and specializes in large-area setting maps. For the past 10 years, she has worked full-time on more than a dozen projects with several well-known publishers.
Brandes Stoddard, Player’s Guide Developer: Brandes Stoddard started out in the video game industry designing crafting systems. From there, he resorted to designing and running LARPs, then degenerated into freelance writing and development. Brandes has worked with a wide variety of publishers, including Kobold Press, Tribality Publishing, Pegasus Spiele, Rite Publishing, and Atomic Overmind. He lives in Atlanta, Georgia, with his wife Rabbit, two sons, and two cats. Find him on Twitter at @brandesstoddard.
Richard Pett, City of Cats Lead Designer: Richard Pett lives on top of a very remote hill in England where place names like Roughpiece Lane and Moisty Knoll are considered normal. His adventures have been tormenting role players for two decades now, and he has yet to get over his peculiar obsession with placing pigs in as many adventures as he can, as prominently as he can. His recent adventure Three Little Pigs is the latest blatant example of his sad porcine obsession. He has a peculiar garret home in Per-Bastet, lurking in an alleyway on the borders of the Gnoll Quarter and the Perfume District.
Meagan Maricle, City of Cats Editor: Meagan Maricle is an editor at Kobold Press and was the lead editor on the Margreve Player’s Guide, Empire of the Ghouls, Underworld Player’s Guide, Tome of Beasts 2, and the ENnie award-winning Creature Codex. When not saving kobolds from their own word traps, she schemes the demise of her players' characters while petting her diabolical, furry companion (“I’ll get you next time, PCs!”). She moved to Washington from Louisiana in 2013, and she has been playing (Advanced) Dungeons and Dragons since the early 90s when her parents turned her into an emerald wyrmling.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because we have completed the design phase and much of the editing for these books, we're in a good position to produce them--though printing and shipping remain challenging. Our primary risks remain health risks to our team and our partners in a pandemic, and logistical risks to ship and fulfill globally after Brexit and with disrupted shipping and supply chains that include new risks to customs, tariffs, and manufacturing. We believe our team can meet these challenges, though we know that some events are simply out of our control.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We will use recycled and recyclable papers in our books.
Sustainable Distribution
We reduce our carbon emissions (and offer cheaper shipping) by shipping via bulk freight to distribution partners around the globe, rather than using air freight.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
Today's update comes with a bit of good news and a bit of bad news. 
The good news is we've made great progress on each of the four books of this Kickstarter. As part of that progress, we added an extensive, 10-page index to the 320-page Southlands Worldbook. With the size, depth, and detail of the Southlands continent, this handy index will help you find every region, city, site, god, and NPC, as well as region-specific information on history, governments, cultures, customs, and much more!

The second round of bonus PDFs is coming to your inboxes! These PDFs detail the City of Brass, how to add it to your world or game, what wonders you'll find there, and the hierarchy of the genies who rule the city. These PDFs also include a 1st-level adventure set in the City of Brass. 
Every backer who pledged at the $25 tier or higher should receive a  direct message from us through Kickstarter’s messaging system in the next few days. This message will contain a code that you can use through the Kobold Press Store to download the PDFs.
How to Claim Your PDF Reward

updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
We hope you are doing well and staying warm in your warrens! Today we have some news about each of the Southlands books.
The City of Cats finished layout, cleared proofing, and is off to the printer!
The Southlands Worldbook is in layout, and we recently received the last of the feedback from our sensitivity readers. Our editorial team is working to integrate those lasts pieces of feedback now.

It’s been two weeks since the Kickstarter ended, and we’re hard at work finishing up stretch goals, exterminating pesky dangling modifiers, and bringing together a cast of heroes who will brave the dangers of the Southlands for you!
That’s right! We have an actual play, Into the Southlands, starting tomorrow, January 17th at 2 PM Pacific / 5 PM Eastern on the Kobold Press Twitch Channel! If you missed out on the Kobold Chat where some of the cast talked about their character concepts and goals for the game, you can find that conversation on our Youtube Channel.

campaign.story:
Once a functional fortress and the cradle of wizards, little now remains of the Scarlet Citadel... on the surface. However, the place is known among adventurers and lorekeepers, and well-trod stairs lead down into the depths.
Deep below, dwarven mercenaries once bred their owlbears for war, the sorcerers of the White Forest practiced their forbidden arts, and strange cults from other realms settled into a place where nodes of power draw together. Their treasures and their remains are scattered across the halls and caverns. Those malevolent creatures that remain still spin their shadowy webs, enchant foul magics, and summon forth the dark gods.
This all-dungeon adventure for levels 1 to 10 presents adventuring in the most classic style of all, facing the foul monsters below the earth and seizing lost treasure. Sharpen your ax and ready your wand, and step forward for adventure in the Scarlet Citadel!
The 5th Edition of the world's first tabletop RPG is all about dungeons (and also dragons, though not in this project!). This is the first dungeon-centric adventure design that Kobold Press has tackled for 5th Edition, and the design effort is led by TSR and Wizards of the Coast veteran Steve Winter, working with notes and characters from Kobold Press publisher Wolfgang Baur's home game.
The result is a classic, old-school dungeon crawl that goes from a surface setting to a deep set of caverns far from the light of the sun, where alien things skitter and guttural chants murmur down chill and damp passageways lit only by magical spheres and phosphorescent fungi.
The Scarlet Citadel includes at least 6 levels of dungeon exploration with lavish maps, plus a town base, appendixes of additional monsters and characters, and a full suite of PDF and virtual tabletop options from Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.
The project will create 6 main items: 
A hardcover book in both regular and limited editions,
A hand-tooled, rich leather edition,
A map folio of poster-sized, table-ready battle maps to play on, 
A fully-optimized PDF,
A digital edition for the Roll20 virtual tabletop (VTT), and
A Fantasy Grounds edition for that VTT platform.
The limited edition will be printed once with a leatherette, foil-stamped cover, ribbon bookmark, special endpapers, and similar touches. The content is identical to the regular edition, but this deluxe, limited edition often becomes extremely sought after.
This project does also offer a handbound leather edition for collectors and bibliophiles. This is done entirely in the traditional style of bookbinding, with excellent leather (likely scarlet-colored) stamped with gold foil and embellished with corded spine, ribbon bookmarks, and other flourishes. This is limited to about a dozen copies and is not available after the Kickstarter. Because of the extra time needed to create it, this reward ships about a month after the other reward packages do.
You can get these items separately or in bundles, and the bundles offer a discount. In addition, the limited edition is available though the Kickstarter, not through later elements such as the survey or pledge manager. (Sometimes we have a few extra limited editions for sale in the Kobold Store—that's never guaranteed!).
The rewards available during the Kickstarter are shown here. 

Because of postal variations and yearly increases in shipping costs, the shipping for print rewards is calculated and charged in the pledge manager after the Kickstarter closes.
This project continues the Kobold Press goal of reducing shipping costs to international backers and shipping in a sustainable way by using friendly, bulk shipments to three main regions: Canada, Australia, and the EU. From there, shipments go out via Canada Post, Australia Post, and either Royal Mail or Deutsche Post. 
As always with our projects, if we exceed our funding goal we will expand the adventure, the maps, and other elements of the project. The more people who support Scarlet Citadel, the better the rewards for everyone.
Our first goal and the next few stretch goals are posted here. More goals will be unlocked once we reach these, and quite a few secrets remain in the depths...
At Kobold Press, a fantastic team of accomplished tabletop gaming professionals is working hard to pull this project together.
Steve Winter, Lead Designer: Steve Winter got his start in the RPG industry by answering a help wanted ad in 1981. He’s managed to make a living from RPGs ever since as editor, developer, managing editor, creative director, web producer, designer, and author on countless roleplaying games, adventures, boardgames, wargames, novels, magazines, and web articles. His most recent work includes Tomb of Annihilation, Tome of Beasts, Deep Magic, and Midgard Heroes Handbook.
Misty Bourne, Lead Editor: Apex editor Misty Bourne is a professional word nerd with a ruthless red pen. An avid 5E player with more than twelve years of publishing experience, some of her more notable projects include: Mythic Odysseys of Theros (Wizards of the Coast), Underworld Lairs and Tome of Beasts 2 (Kobold Press), and the Epic Legacy series, Total Party Kill series, and Tyrants & Hellions (2CGaming). She edits Hit Point Press’s “Big Bads” (2020 silver ENNIE winner) and is currently authoring the guidebook for HPP’s Animated Tarot, slated for release in 2021.
Jon Pintar, Lead Cartographer: Jon Pintar is an illustrator and concept artist working mostly in tabletop games. Designing worlds is his passion, and his maps are published in dozens of products from publishers such as Kobold Press, Worldspinner, and Absolute Tabletop. He lives in Slovenia, on the sunny side of the Alps, and is never far from a medieval castle. You can find him on Twitter at @JonPintar.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kobold Press has shipped over 37 crowdfunded titles since 2006, both small and large, with 15 of them on Kickstarter (this is #16). The Kobolds have won Gold and Silver ENnie Awards for this work, most recently an ENnie for the Creature Codex for 5th Edition in 2019 as Best Monster/Adversary book. The creative team is experienced, and we keep leveling up!

For Scarlet Citadel, much of the adventure design and cartography is already done. Likewise, we already have the cover and a portion of the interior art commissioned because of our confidence in this book. 

The main challenges are in editing the material, creating additional maps generated by stretch goals, layout of the books, and managing the uncertain landscape for printing and shipping.

Other risks include entirely new ones: the health of the core team of kobolds (editor, art director, and publisher), as well as business-related risks from COVID-related printer delays plus the recent tampering with the US Post Office. We'll keep you informed on any delays if they arise. 

And if we spring a trap or two on the way back to the surface? Well, surely one or two kobolds will survive to tell the tale!

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager Closing Soon - Only One Week Left!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
The Pledge Manager for Scarlet Citadel closes on May 1st. Pledge Manager is how we collect pre-order and Kickstarter shipping details, and all backers should've received emails in February with Pledge Manager surveys. Be sure to check your address on Pledge Manager and make any last minute adjustments to your order. If you haven't accessed Pledge Manager yet, check this update for details on how to access it.

The printer sent proofs of the map folio for final checks to make sure they didn't lose any rooms or tricksy kobold traps in the print process. When we unfolded the maps, we found them to be almost kobold-sized, and we just couldn't resist sharing them all with you!
Please be aware, these are laser-printer proofs for us to double-check that each section of the map appears correctly. They are not the final maps, which will be printed on thick, coated stock.

Ready to be horrified?
The Crossroads at Midnight is an all-new, one-woman anthology by critically-acclaimed cartoonist Abby Howard, full of evocative, unnerving, slice-of-life horror. Five separate stories in this paperback,  380-page volume explore the consequences of what happens when one is desperate enough to seek solace in the unnatural.
This book is not for kids; we recommend it for teens and adults.
But if you back Crossroads here on Kickstarter, you can get a two-book bundle, including the 400-page, paperback first volume of Abby's middle-grade series: The Last Halloween, Vol. 1: Children.  
The Last Halloween is the story on Mona, a 10-year-old girl shut indoors on Halloween night... until a monster appears in her living room. It heralds an entire monster invasion of Earth, with billion of creatures running rampant. Mona and her newly-acquired motley crew of good-hearted ghouls must stop this invading horde, or this will likely be... the last Halloween.
So back us on Kickstarter, and get yourself (and a kid in your life) some great horror comics.

updates.update_content:
Happy Saturday, everyone!

We're just checking in to let everyone know: if you have completed our Backerkit survey,  your order (barring orders with address issues we'll have to troubleshoot on a case-by-case basis, about 100 orders out of the ~4,000  total we fulfilled across three projects) is IN THE MAIL.

updates.update_userinfo: You have 48 HOURS to fill out your Backerkit survey/update your addresses! Shipping begins SOON!
updates.update_content:
IT'S FINALLY HAPPENING, everybody!
After a long, long wait, for which we are eternally grateful you have all sat through with endless patience and grace:  Fulfillment of this project is about to begin.
If you have yet to fill out your Backerkit survey— and 68 of you still have not— please do so within the next 48 hours. Click this link! Remember to use your Kickstarter-associated email.

Hey, all. Spike here.
Don't get too excited, this is a quick, li'l, Kickstarter-mandated update.
This account was founded in 2009, the year Kickstarter launched, under the name "IronSpike." The name I used everywhere, so that was only natural.
However, in the last 12 years? It's grown into something far beyond just me. Iron Circus Comics, formerly just a glorified self-publishing DBA, has grown into a small-mid graphic novel publishing house, the largest of its kind in Chicago, possibly the entire Midwest.

Hello again, everyone. Spike here.
I wish I had better news, but there isn't any.
Our fulfillment agent, Blackbox, underwent a change of leadership in 2020, and things have been more difficult since. The system is different, as is the warehouse location and contacts. This has tacked months onto a process we're accustomed to taking two to three weeks.

updates.update_content:
Good morning, folks! Spike here!
And for a change, I've got some good news (GREAT news, really): Abby Howard has launched a new Kickstarter for a video game!
Scarlet Hollow is a choice-driven horror adventure game and visual novel brought to life by critically acclaimed graphic novelist Abby Howard (The Last Halloween, The Crossroads at Midnight, Junior Scientist Power Hour!). Visiting the dying Appalachian coal town of Scarlet Hollow for the funeral of your long-lost aunt, you soon find yourself embroiled in a generations-long mystery that threatens an entire town. Who lives, who dies, and how the story ends is in your hands!

Hey again, folks, Spike here.

If you backed this project for $666, part of your backer rewards was a custom commission from Abby Howard. Please check your Kickstarter DMs, $666 backers, for instructions on how to fulfill that part of your rewards!

campaign.story:
We reached 100% in just under an hour!! Thank you all so much! We've already added a whole bunch of awesome extras through meeting stretch goals!
Every physical copy of Cute! will now come with a hard enamel pin, a holographic bookplate, two postcard-sized prints with foil details, a holographic sticker, and a sticker sheet!  
Every tier with an Enamel Pin Set will now come with an extra enamel pin! (so TWO extra enamel pins total including the regular bonus enamel pin!)
Every digital copy of Cute will now come with two bonus wallpapers! 
Hi! I'm Sarah Graley, the creator of Our Super Adventure, a diary webcomic about living with four cats and a cat-like boy! I've been making Our Super Adventure comics since 2012 and Stef also helps out with writing, lettering and colour assisting the comics too!
I really like making comics about the weird silly moments in my life and relationships, and I often hear so much from readers that they experience those moments too! You can read a whole bunch of Our Super Adventure comics over at my Webtoon page!
I also write and draw other comics, like Donut The Destroyer (Scholastic Graphix), Glitch (Scholastic Graphix), Kim Reaper (Oni Press) and Rick and Morty: Lil' Poopy Superstar (Oni Press)! I'm also the artist on the official Minecraft graphic novels, Volume 1 and Volume 2 (Dark Horse)!
I've previously run three super-successful Kickstarter projects for Our Super Adventure Vol. 1, Our Super Adventure Vol. 2 & Our Super Canadian Adventure and now I'm back with a brand new Our Super Adventure book - Our Super Adventure Vol. 3: Cute! 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to fund a self-published print run of a brand new Our Super Adventure collection, collecting all of the Our Super Adventure comics from 2019 to 2020! The book will have gold foil details on the cover, and will be around 224 pages long!  
 Our Super Adventure is a diary comic all about me, Sarah, and my everyday life with my partner, Stef, and our four cats - Pesto, Toby, Wilson and Pixel! We joke about a whole bunch with one another and we've got a shared love of video games, music and pizza!
I started making these comics as a way of keeping track of various sweet or funny moments that happened, and since starting to post them online eight(!) years ago, they seem to have found their way to so many other people who have had similar sweet moments in their own lives and relationships!
 We always thought we were kinda silly - we're definitely in the adult phase of our lives but at the same time we don't really feel like adults - but after hundreds of conversations with like-minded people at comic conventions and online, maybe we're all a little bit silly in the same way? 
We love our cats a whole bunch! We have four of them and they feature in the comics a lot! We've got two girl cats (Pesto and Toby) and two boy cats (Wilson and Pixel). They're all wonderful and we feel lucky that we get to share our lives with them!
We've done three of these projects now: Our Super Adventure Vol. 1 back in 2015, Our Super Adventure Vol. 2 in 2018, and Our Super Canadian Adventure last year. 
We're overjoyed to be back with Our Super Adventure Vol. 3: Cute! - a brand new collection collecting Our Super Adventure comics from 2019 to 2020!
For this Kickstarter project, we want to collect all of the Our Super Adventure strips posted online during 2019 and 2020, and combine those with 50 brand new never-been-online comics to make another hardback collection of Our Super Adventure comics! 
We're also going to include a whole bunch of extra content like my Hourly Comic Day Comics from 2019 and 2020, some redrawn fan-favourite comics from the first Our Super Adventure book, and we're going to include a thumbnail gallery and photo gallery again too! The final hardback book is going to be 224 pages long with gold foiling details on the cover, and we're feeling really excited about it! 
We love physical comic books - our house is full of comic books that we've bought over the last ten years - and in a time when you can read comics online or digitally super easily, we're strong believers in making really nice looking books! In each Kickstarter so far we've had the opportunity to make some really beautiful books and there's no way that would have happened without the support of our wonderful Kickstarter backers!
We're here to ask for your help in making this book happen - we're doing this one totally self-published, and 2020 is a weird year! In return, we're offering rewards like Kickstarter-exclusive enamel pins, a Kickstarter-exclusive t-shirt, and, oh yeah, the book itself! 
Our Super Adventure Vol. 3: Cute! will be a square hardback book measuring around 16cm x 16cm. It's going to have gold foiling on the cover and we're really excited to see this one in print!
The book will contain 150 Our Super Adventure comic strips - That's all the comics posted online during 2019 and 2020 so far and 50 of those are book exclusive! The book will be around 224 pages long and full colour!
We're going to be including loads of extras too - my Hourly Comic Day comics from 2019 and 2020, a small collection of bonus Twitter comics, a photo diary, a comic thumbnail gallery, and 10 redrawn fan-favourite comics from Our Super Adventure Vol. 1! (Get ready for That's My Idiot, 2020-style!).
All books will be signed by me and Stef as standard, and all tiers from £20 and higher will be signed, doodled in and personalised! 
This enamel pin set is exclusive to this Kickstarter! We love video games and pizza and cats and this set of Wilson and Pesto show that off pretty nicely! Both pins are hard enamel and 3cm tall in size!
Our incredible backers unlocked our third stretch goal, which mean that every enamel pin set now comes with a third enamel pin!
This Kickstarter-exclusive t-shirt is a two colour screen-printed design featuring Pesto the cat on top of a whole mountain of pizza slices! We're using Gildan Softstyle t-shirts - they're lightweight and good quality! (Sizes available - Unisex S - 5XL*)
*Size 4XL and 5XL might be a different t-shirt brand depending on availability
These were unlocked through our first stretch goal! Every copy of Cute! will come with one of these! 
These postcard sized prints were unlocked through our second stretch goal! Every copy of Cute! will come with this set of two prints! 
 This cat-themed sticker sheet was unlocked through our fourth second stretch goal! Every copy of Cute! will come with this sticker sheet!
This holographic sticker was an unlocked stretch goal bonus and it will come with every physical copy of Cute!
We decided to unlock our final stretch goal early as a thank you to our wonderful backers and supporters! Every physical copy of Cute! will now come with this bonus enamel pin! 
We've also got copies of the other Our Super Adventure books available!    
 For this Kickstarter campaign we're offering free shipping to UK addresses, and reduced shipping costs for everywhere else!

This campaign will fund this first self-published print run, and we'll be sending out all the books to you directly!

We’ve got regular suppliers that we use for pins and t-shirts and they make good quality things and deliver on time so we’re confident about using them.

We’re using a new book printer and we're confident that the books will look amazing!

We’re using itch.io to deliver all digital rewards and we've used them twice before and everything has gone pretty smoothly!

If we hit any snags, we'll keep everyone up to date with constant updates! We're already accounting for some delays in deliveries, just in case!

All designs on this page are pretty final but allow for some slight variations when it comes to the finished books and rewards!

campaign.story:
While making bread in Seattle... we got frustrated with the butter dishes we had. Knives falling off the tray, lids making butter rings on the counter, bulky lids that slid around while carrying, difficulty scooping up butter.  And we didn't see many stylish designs. So we decided to do something about it. Introducing...
SMARTER BUTTER DISH DESIGN
 MAGNETIC LID - A magnet on the lid keeps the included butter knife with your dish. It also serves as a place to rest a butter-covered knife during use. No more searching for a knife.
 EXTENDED FEET - With most butter dishes, you remove the lid, put it down, and have a messy ring of butter on the table. We designed extended feet to hold the lid off the table so the table stays clean.
 RAMPS - Ramps on the sides of the dish allow you to scoop up butter easier. They also serve as scraping edges to scrape the knife clean. No more pushing butter onto your knife.
 EVERYTHING SECURE - The lid feet lock the lid into the tray and the knife is magnetically held by the magnet. So everything stays together and can be carried with one hand. No more dishes and knives sliding and falling on the floor.
Magnetic lid to hold your knife
A magnet built into the lid provides an easy place to rest your knife during use, even with butter on it. Other dishes leave you wondering where to put your knife so you don't get butter on the counter.
No more butter mess on the table
We designed extended feet under the lid so that any butter mess on the sides of the lid is kept off the table. Most butter dishes have flat lids that leave a ring of butter on the table or you have to flip the lid over before you put it down.
Easily scoop up butter
We designed ramps at both ends of the butter dish so you can easily scoop up butter. Just slide your knife up the ramp. Use it to scoop up cold butter or a soft mess of butter. Then use the top of the ramp to scrape the knife clean.
Carry lid and knife with one hand
Butter Hub is your "hub" for butter. Everything is together and carried easily with one hand. Other dishes are bulky and require two hands to pickup and then you have to go looking for a knife, usually having to take another trip to the kitchen to get your mug or bread.
Easily scrape knife clean
We designed raised scraping edges to help scrape knife clean or transfer butter from one side of the knife to the other.  Other butter dishes are too low and have no edge, making it hard to scrape off butter.
A lid and knife that doesn't slide off the tray
The lid has feet that lock into the tray so that it doesn't slide when carried. And the knife too is magnetically held in place. No more flying knives and sliding ceramic lids.
Four colors - Black, Grey, White, Clear
Butter Knife Included
Our included stainless steel butter knife is shaped with a bend to help scoop up butter at a higher angle of use. It works perfectly with our magnetic lid. But you may use your own steel knife. It's best for magnetic contact if it is more flat and not round.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.
Limited Colors
Due to the unexpected popularity of this project, we are fairly certain that not all colors will be available to all backers as expected.  Some backers will have to wait an extra couple of months if they want to be certain of a color they want.  For example, it seems that white is much more popular than other colors and we would run out. If we run out of one color, we will give backers the choice of choosing another available color or waiting approximately 2 months to get the color they want.  The first backers to answer their surveys after the campaign will be the first to secure the color they want. We have already begun production of a second batch of BUTTER HUB dishes to cover all colors selections, eventually.  Please bear with us as we deal with these logistical issues to treat each backer equally.

We've shipped previous products to more than 30,000 backers and don't expect any problems in fulfilling your orders. Our Kickstarter reviews have been super positive.
