campaign.story:
Read this page in: Deutsch | Française | Polski | Italiano | Português | Español | Русский | 日本語 | 中国
 The First Act of Sin Slayers is available on Steam
Sin Slayers is a dark fantasy RPG with roguelike elements, where the player’s decisions directly influence combat difficulty and enemy strength.
Create, equip and lead a team of heroes with their own particular abilities and flaws, and determine your own battle strategy. Forge your way through foul woods, cemeteries crowded with crumbling mausoleums and the graves of fallen warriors, and other locations to inspire horror in the most stalwart of hearts.
Among other challenges, exhausting battles and devious traps will drain your heroes’ energy. But don’t despair just yet! Your team will be able to replenish their health at the Fountain between battles, and in the Old Church between campaigns.
Explore the Valley, discover new weapons as loot or for completing quests, collect potion ingredients and elements to craft armor and amulets. If you cannot craft an item yourself, the Blacksmith in the Old Church is always available to assist. Only the best equipment will enable you to defeat your ruthless opponents.
— 3 game modes: Explore 7 locations full of secrets and artifacts; watch for traps; defeat strong and skillful mobs; and test your might in numerous arena battles.

— Unique in-game action evaluation system – 'Sinmeter': consider your actions carefully, as the locals will never forgive your mistakes. As your Sinmeter increases, mobs become stronger and your potential to earn additional loot increases.

— Randomly generated maps with various events and encounters: get ready for surprises, riddles and mysteries on every step of your grim trek through the Valley.

— Game regions with individual events, game settings and bosses: explore the Valley of Fallen Sinners and learn the unique abilities of both your heroes and enemies. Knowledge of enemies and the game world can raise your chances to prevail.

— 10 heroes to build up your team and individual skillsets: choose your characters and equipment, change up your range of abilities and magic skills. The strategies you choose will determine the outcome of the final battle.

— Turn-based combat, JRPG style: will test the might of heroes in the battle against hundreds of dreadful fiends.

— Additional quests: Apart from defeating the relentless mobs, game results will depend on your readiness to aid strange characters asking for your help, and mystical creatures with weird requests along the way.
Under an impenetrable veil of fog, deep woods and reeking swamps, it hosts legions of malicious brutes, cursed warriors, the undead, and other monsters who ceaselessly prowl for prey to glut their thirst for new souls.
The Valley is home to outright villains who faced death in the wake of their sins, whose souls were utterly absorbed in endless night. Who once lived as glorious heroes, praised in song amongst thousands of worlds, alas, let darkness consume their lives and ultimately devour their souls.
No peace awaits these doomed heroes, cursed to wander in torment forever, unless they break the seven seals of the Portal of Worlds and sever the black magic binding them to the Valley.
No man has ever succeeded in this quest, nor broken free from the Valley’s bonds.
Every seal is guarded by a Sin Lord – the utmost villainous incarnation of one of the seven deadly sins.
Nothing but complete victory over the seven Sin Lords can free the numberless wayward souls from their dire fate. So the legends say...
Lead a group of heroes, each with their own pros and cons. You cannot take all of them at once, however, as some must remain behind to protect the Church. You must choose only three characters to form your vanguard for each mission.
Warrior 
The Warrior is a strong and skillful combatant. In battle, he brags an expertise with swords, as well as the ability to inspire dread in his foes. The Warrior is the most balanced character of the group. He is able to both strike enemies and protect other group members.
Defender 
The Defender is so named for a good reason. His gear includes the best armor, the sharpest spear and a broad tower shield. Long years of training in the art of protection can solidly defend any squad, even in the direst circumstances.
Priest 
This Sister of the Sainted Cross fears no demon or undead. Her righteous prayers will heal the severest injuries. Her weaknesses include low health and being restricted to light armor, but if well supported she will ensure every squad member survives the battle.
Huntress 
The Huntress can skillfully handle both bow and sword. Whether facing a beast or a wayward spirit, her arrows will always hit the target. Her standard leather armor is compensated by perfect combat skills, while her acute eyesight and agility allow the group to avoid unnecessary battles. 
Paladin 
Much like the Priests of the Sainted Cross, the Paladin cannot live without worship and God. His righteous words and mighty hammer raise the spirits of his allies and crush the spirits of their enemies. The Paladin is also useful for simple healing and advanced blessings to empower allies and protect the group.
Take note: yet more heroes, to be revealed later, will join your crusade against the Sin Lords. 
Remember, the Sin Lords have their pros and cons as well, thus you must create a unique squad for every battle. You will find every hero has their use in one or another situation.
Every hero has his own skills and abilities, although in the beginning they are limited in number and it will take serious effort to achieve some of them.
Each hero features their own individual Skill Tree. New skills become available at a cost measured in the souls of your defeated foes, rather than hero level. Thus to discover all the skills, you must win many battles.
On top of all these abilities, each hero can assist their team outside combat as well. For example, the Warrior can scout nearby to find points of interest, and the Priest can heal allies outside of combat.
Create health potions, armor, resurrection tokens, weapons and other artifacts to can help you in your struggle against legions of demons.
Different heroes have access to different armor and weapon types. To equip all your heroes, you may want to craft custom items instead of waiting for a particular random drop from enemies.
Moreover, since every boss requires its own approach, it’s wise to adapt if you don't like hardcore challenges.
Welcome to the Valley of Fallen Sinners, where seven incarnations of the deadly sins reign eternal.
A dense, preternatural fog lays like stinking breath over black woods. Legions of malicious brutes, cursed warriors, the undead, and worse chthonian horrors, all with an unslakable craving for new souls to perpetuate their own unnatural life. 
At one time, they lived as brave heroes across a thousand worlds, and bards composed ballads to their noble deeds. Until the day darkness flooded their hearts and ripped them apart.
Though their souls are now heavy with repentance, they will wander without rest unless a courageous adventurer can unite them all and defeat the seven incarnations of the deadly sins. But the truth is that of the multitude who have come before, none has ever accomplished this.
Sin Lord dens are surrounded by crowds of mobs waiting to devour the souls of lost heroes. Let’s get acquainted with some of these horrors.
Pigman 
Filthy and stinking from a long way off, Pigman Warriors pose little threat of a surprise attack. Awful hygiene aside, they are skilled and deadly fighters. Their swift attacks can cripple unprepared wanderers. Shrewd tactics is the only way to defeat them once and forever.
Ghosts 
Wayward souls search for a retreat amongst the litter of graves and crypts. Do your best to avoid them, as their attacks can invoke a powerful curse that will be difficult to dispel in the underworld.
Cursed 
While the surviving comrades feasted after the battle, their fallen fellows awoke in the world between worlds. Despite their lack of a shield, steel armor protects them from attacks and their spears are sharp enough to slice a wanderer's arm clean off. Our feeling is you will long remember every battle against them.
Slimes 
Some demons in the Valley of Fallen Sinners are too weak to take a definite shape. Usually these are incarnated as sluglike monstrosities.  But do not dismiss the threat these demons pose. The Slime’s poisonous attacks and resistance to physical damage can prove a severe headache for even the most experienced adventurer.
These are only a few residents of the first two locations.
The Seven Sin Lords and their acolytes reign over the Valley of Fallen Sinners, which they have divided into seven regions. You must destroy all of them to make your way to the divine light. Every Sin Lord is unique, therefore your tactics must vary if you wish to have any hope of defeating them.
For example, let's take a look at Gluttony. 
This battle will be wear-and-tear, as this Sin Lord is almost invulnerable in his first form. Therefore, it might be a good idea to take characters with high durability, and artifacts granting additional vitality and health regeneration.
Prior to the battle against Gluttony, you will encounter the Pigman Shaman, who will continuously summon new Pigmen to fight for him. In contrast to Gluttony, in this battle you must field a strong team to kill the Shaman’s backup as soon as possible.
As you can see, even this early in the game you must use two very different approaches. There will be much more to learn in the full version of the game.
Sin Slayers employs a classic turn-based combat system in keeping with the best JRPG traditions. Put together your team of three legendary heroes and show off your tactical skills in the clash against demonic atrocities in the Valley of Fallen Sinners.
Characters speed decides who takes the first turn. The battle continues until one side is defeated or retreat.
Enemies await you left and right, ready to attack with all their might, so be ready to make difficult decisions, even to the point of sacrificing your teammates.
Among the legions of demons and infested swamps, you will find an island of hope to inspire fear among even the strongest of your opponents – the Old Church. While roaming the Valley of Fallen Sinners, the Church will be your haven and stronghold, granting you a safe place to rest and replenish your supplies. You can also invite other characters encountered on the way to join you here. Many of them will set up their stalls in the Church and help you with not only a good word, but a good deed as well.
Be careful during your journey to pay close attention to such opportunities.
How do we make every playthru both unique and as challenging as the previous one? Our random location generator! New game terrain is generated at random every time you press the "Let's go" button to start your journey. This means players discover something new every time they play the game. Do you think you know every bit of rubble and bone in the cemetery? You may find on a return visit that it's nothing like you expected! 
The World Map is divided into seven independent locations – one for each Sin Lord. There are also some places where you can rest and re-equip your team, like the Old Church, for example
We’ve prepared some cool in-game rewards for our community. To get them, you'll need to subscribe, like, repost, etc. Think of every milestone as a small quest. The completed quests award you with achievement points, which in turn unlock the new game bonuses.

By purchasing this pledge you will support our game's development. We will send you a selection of digital wallpapers and postcards to use on your PC or mobile device. You'll also earn a place in the credits with our other supporters. But most important, you'll receive a heartwarming thank you letter filled with love and gratitude from our development team. 
This pledge will earn you a digital copy of our game on final release, and a unique in-game item to be chosen by our Kickstarter community. Yes, you'll also be invited to take part in this survey. With the game, you'll also receive all future DLCs and other players will be able to find your name during an in-game quest. Thanks to this quest, your name will forever be inscribed in a "Sinners" book in the Old Church.  You also receive everything from the previous pledge. 
Choosing this pledge, you'll feel like a sinner even sooner. Not only will you receive everything from the previous pledges, but access to the beta version of Sin Slayers as well! 
This pledge is for true collectors. In addition to everything from the previous pledges, you'll get a digital artbook, soundtrack and the in-game "Sinners" book will also feature information about your sin. 
Want to buy a pledge for yourself and a friend? We’ve got you covered. This tier includes everything from the Templar pledge x2. 
You're a true Sin Slayer and like to travel in groups of 3, so grab 2 more keys for your friends and everything from the Templar pledge. In addition, you'll get to name an item and think up its description. Your portrait will also be added to the "Sinners" book. 
This is the pledge for those who’ve always wanted to create their own in-game enemy. Our designer will contact you to make this dream come true. This pledge also includes everything from the Blacksmith tier pledge. 
This is the pledge for those who want to create a trusted in-game companion. Our designer will contact you and make your wildest dream come true! This pledge also includes everything from the Blacksmith tier pledge. 
This pledge is for true artists. It includes everything from the Blacksmith pledge, a 4th game key, and your personal or company logo which will be featured on the loading screen. Together with our designer, you'll also draw a background for a combat encounter. 
You're the true leader of the Sin Slayers and know exactly the sort of quest to set any warrior on the road to salvation. Our designer will help you make this vision a reality. In addition, you'll receive everything from the Hand of Creation pledge. 
As a Holy Progenitor you'll receive everything from all previous tiers. You will also join the development team for two days in our office in Kirov, Russia! Accomodation and entertainment are included. Travel expenses are not. 
Team Goonswarm
We are a small team of indie game developers. Every goonswarm team member has unrivaled expertise in game development. Our collective experience includes such companies as GD-Team, Gaijin Entertainment, and Game Insight. Our priority is to develop the products that first of all interest us as players. So far, we have published Alteric for РС/Mac and PS4/XBox/Nintendo Switch/PSP, as well as Pandarama: The Lost Toys for Android/iOS.
Sin Slayers is a passion project for us. The game has already received positive feedback from our fans, and furthermore won the Indie Prize Finalist title at Casual Connect Serbia, 2018.
Why Kickstarter ?
We develop our game for over a year and already have a working Alpha version of the game. Publisher can finance the game, but budget is limited and we can't make our game as good as we initially intended.
  Because of that we want to ask you, roguelike and RPG fans for help. Help us make another great addition to the roguelike family. Let's tell the world once again that indie games are the future of the gaming industry.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are developing this game for a while already. However, despite our experience and best efforts, there’s always a chance that something will go wrong.
 
1. All of the people on our team have already delivered commercially successful games on time and in great condition. However, there is always a chance that we'll need to postpone Sin Slayers release date. At least for an extra polish.
 
2. There's always a possibility that we won't be able to deliver some rewards or contact backers who pledged their designs on time.
 
3. A drastic change in rates of currency, financial depression, and other unforeseen economic consequences may rob our game of some of the promised content. The odds of that are amazingly low, but it's only fair to mention that as a risk.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
AcadeCon 2019: Ours goes to 7
AcadeCon is a 3-day tabletop gaming convention at the Dayton Convention Center, in Dayton, Ohio. November 8th - 10th, 2019.  
AcadeCon would not exist if not for The RPG Academy podcast and they are forever intertwined.  The motto of the Podcast is "if you're having fun, you're doing it right!' and our goal has always been to help more people play games and have more fun while doing it.
We're not into telling our listeners they should play the way we play, but instead - play the way that's the most fun for them at their table and with their group.  And that's the same attitude we bring to AcadeCon.  We don't go in for edition waring or gatekeeping. AcadeCon is open to gamers of all types and experiences levels. No matter which games you love, you're likely to find people at AcadeCon who also love that game and if not you'll probably find people open to learning it from you or happy to teach you the game(s) they love. We want to provide a place for people to play these games and have fun. 
AcadeCon started in Michael's basement and no matter how large it grows, the idea of playing games with your friends will always be at the heart of what we're trying to do and that's where the AcadeCon motto comes from:  Gaming with friends, old and new!
In addition to playing games with friends (old and new), AcadeCon offers almost unprecedented access to some amazing RPG designers, authors, and fan favorite podcasting personalities. At AcadeCon, these people are there to have fun and play games, just like you. Join into one of their events and don't be surprised if they join into one of yours!
If that sounds like something you’d like to support then this is the place for you. If you can, support our Kickstarter by going ahead and buying your badge now. We know it's early and life can change so we do offer the option of getting a refund (minus the 10% we lose to Kickstarter fees) up until November 1st.  
Thank you for checking out our Kickstarter and we hope to see you in November!
                                 What's AcadeCon all about?
AcadeCon is specifically designed to be a smaller, non-traditional convention. We are not trying to (nor do we want to) compete with or replace the huge conventions that attract a national audience. At our convention, you're going to get access to some of the most amazing GMs and players, a better chance to play in the games you want, the opportunity to spend time and game with special guests, and time to hang out with some of the best gamers in the world—the fans of our show and returning AcadeCon alumni.
Joe Meade is taking some play testers through a session of Omens of Destiny. Look for it soon from NobleQuest.
Whether you are one of our listeners, are interested in meeting and playing with some of our special guests, or just found us by accident, we hope you'll consider grabbing a badge or maybe just a donation to help keep AcadeCon around in Dayton for years to come.
Mike from Flatworks Gaming grabbed one of our vendor tables and ran demos and sold copies of Dwarven Smithy all weekend long.
AcadeCon 2019 is our 7th annual gaming convention. From that first year of 15 people to last year with over 500, AcadeCon continues to grow. Help us grow by coming to play games with us and telling all your friends about us as well.
Want to see more pictures from previous AcadeCons?
Photo Gallery from AcadeCon 2016
Photo Gallery from AcadeCon 2017
Photo Gallery from AcadeCon 2018
Here are some podcast recaps where folks have talked about their experiences at AcadeCons past. Listen to hear why they love it so and why you should experience it for yourself.

and here are some more reasons you should support our project now and grab and badge to join us later -
  Special guests.
Each year we invite a wealth of RPG Podcasters, Game designers and fiction authors to come hang out with us. Some do panels, some hold live events, some run games and some may join into your game.
  In addition to covering our deposits, this KS will help us set our budget for bringing in guests for this year and scheduling them early helps ensure they are able to join us.
Confirmed guests for this year:
Rob Schwalb  - Schwalb Entertainment

Many more are expected to confirm as we get closer to the event.
For an up to date list of our special guests, click here
OTHER SUPER COOL THINGS THAT ARE HAPPENING
We're super excited to have ConTessa joining us for this year's event.
ConTessa is a nonprofit organization that runs events of all types at conventions all over the United States. Our primary goal is to increase the number of marginalized people in all aspects of tabletop gaming through the power of positive representation. Our volunteers run and teach roleplaying games, miniature war games, board games, LARPs, and card games. In addition, we run board game socials using our own board game library, panels on topics that span the whole range of gaming experiences, and provide our volunteers with everything they need to succeed from snacks to dry-erase game mats. Together, we move the needle on making conventions more diverse. 

Games on Demand is an open-gaming event put on at various conventions, sometimes under the “Indie Games Exposion” organizational label. It typically consists of designated area with tables, materials, and a constant supply of enthusiastic volunteers prepared to run a variety of independent and cutting edge games. 

                            Space Bridge Simulator 
ARTEMIS Space Bridge Simulator
Our inner sci-fi nerds are insanely happy to have this chance to pull on those costumes that we don't tell anyone about and log some time on the Artemis Space Bridge Simulator. Sponsored by Dwarven Woodworking this is going to one of the highlights of the convention. Registration information for these games will be included in the gaming schedule when it is released after the campaign ends. Unlike many conventions that host a simulator, ours does not cost extra. It's all included in your badge—though we won't be upset if you give them a donation or purchase some of their wares in exchange for their presence at AcadeCon. 
Sponsored by  Double Exposure, the Envoy program is unique and awesome! The Double Exposure team will provide us with about 25 brand-new games that you can try out during AcadeCon. Every time you play a demo, you are entered into a drawing to win that game! You can play the same game multiple times to get a better chance at winning something you really enjoy or play them all and see if Lady Luck is smiling on you.
Open Game Library:
All badge holders are able to check out any of our game library games free of charge (with ID) during our regular event hours. To see a current list of all the games we have CLICK HERE. Don't see your favorite?  donate a copy to us or increase your pledge level by enough to cover the price and and we'll buy a copy to add in.  At worst, shoot us a msg that you'd like to see that game added and we'll see if we can get a copy before this year's event.
Code of Conduct & Terms of Service.
AcadeCon is an inclusive gaming event open to gamers of all types. Every attendee will be subject to our Code of Conduct and Terms of Service.
Further - all attendees agree to abide by our terms of service. This is to ensure every attendee feels welcome. Failure to comply with our ToS can result in expulsion from AcadeCon without a refund.  At it's heart we ask that you don't be a jerk, but for all the details follow the link - Click here to read our terms of service:
Thank you for taking a look at our campaign. We truly hope you'll consider supporting us now and grabbing a badge later to come out to play games with us in November.
Stretch goals:
Based on last year, we may have rented out more space in the DCC than we needed and wasted space made us less profitable.  For this year we're going to step back and bit and our initial goal is to raise enough money for room 101, the larger main gaming room.  At $13,700.00 we can rent that space and pay for all the miscellaneous things that go along with it.
After the initial goal we'll be using additional funds to rent out the side rooms which we used for Panels, Seminars, and Entertainment events.  Each increment of $300 will allow us to rent one of these rooms for one day.
More stretch goals . . .  if we manage to get enough funds to rent all the space we would want or need  we will find a way to use those funds to improve the overall experience.  
ADD ONs
Kickstarter exclusive T-shirts.  While we will have a few T-shirts for sale during the event it helps us to know what people want and what sizes they need. If you'd like to pre-order a T-shirt that is only available through the Kickstarter you can add either $18 or $20 (for sizes XXL and XXXL). We'll reach out before the order to ask your size and preferred cut.
AcadeCon 2019 D6+1's.  Each of our guests received one of our commemorative D6's each year. If you'd like to add on 3 more to get a full set of 4 please add $2.00 to your pledge. If you'd like even more, add $1.00 per die you'd like added. Please contact us via the KS messaging system to let us know what your over pledge is for.
AcadeCon 2019 Token chip. Currently our VIP guests get 5 of our yearly poker chip tokens and we sell them during the event. If you'd like to pre-order them we can provide them at a discount vs the for-sale price.  For each chip you'd like, please add $1.00 to your pledge. Please contact us via the KS messaging system to let us know what your over pledge is for.
Risks and challenges
At this point, the biggest risk is that we don't fund, in which case the event does not happen. If we can't make it to our minimal funding we can't afford to put on the show. As long as we fund, only a catastrophe would stop the event from happening.
Beyond that, we are having the event in southern Ohio in November. We can't control the weather so there may be a chance that people coming from out of town may have difficulty getting there or back. We are not responsible for any travel arrangements, costs, or difficulties.
This is our 7th year running AcadeCon and 5th as a public event. We know we can put on a fun show if we have enough people that are willing to join us.

campaign.story:
Rocketbook Beacons allow you to capture, organize and broadcast important notes, diagrams, and big ideas on any whiteboard or wall surface in real-time. No need for expensive new hardware and software. Just four restickable "beacons" for any sized surface and one futuristic smartphone app that connects with many of the popular cloud services you already use!
Place the four restickable beacon quadra-triangles in each corner of any size whiteboard, and start writing the way you normally would. Then download the free Rocketbook app. When you scan your whiteboard with the app, the space aged machine vision will “see” the Beacons and quickly capture your whiteboard from any angle. 
Rocketbook Beacons can modernize any size whiteboard you have hanging around. If your surface area is small, and every inch of writing space counts, simply cut the beacons to size and the app will still capture your work! The majority of whiteboards (over 3 feet wide or high) will work great without trimming!
The Rocketbook app will instantly adjust and visually enhance your scans so the digital version is light years ahead of the real thing.
The Rocketbook app allows you to assign 7 shortcut symbols to "destinations" in the cloud which could be any folder inside Dropbox, Evernote, Google Docs, your email address, and many other popular services.
Set up the app to instantly beam your notes, diagrams, and big ideas. And save precious time by transcribing your handwriting with powerful optical character recognition (OCR) technology.
For crucial missions with a scattered crew, the app allows you to stream your whiteboard in real-time. Switch to “Broadcast” mode, share the unique URL and get ready to collaborate with your team anywhere in the world. Your private, real-time page is updated every time you scan your whiteboard. Or simply prop your phone facing your whiteboard and set the app to auto-scan every 5 seconds. 
Rocketbook Beacons are made with space aged micro-suction technology that is specially designed to stick to whiteboard surfaces. This synthetic and durable material acts like millions of microscopic suction cups that cling to your whiteboard and won't deteriorate over time like other sticky adhesives.  The beacons can even be cleaned to ensure a quality bond with each use! 
The Rocketbook app can transcribe your handwriting with OCR or “Optical Character Recognition” technology. Transcription allows you to send a digital text version of your whiteboard, or even search through all of your scans with keywords and phrases. You can even auto-name your files by placing two hashtags ‘#’ on either side of a title like ##THIS TITLE##. Traditional surfaces will never be the same! 
For more information on our OCR features, fly over to the Rocketbook Launch page
Customers & Duties Information For International Orders
We cannot mark as gift, this is illegal so we will not be able to do this.
Our prices do not include VAT, GST or other country taxes.
As many of you know, our terms of sale are CIF destination. This means that we pay all freight, but none of the duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Kickstarter.
As many of you know, Canadian Customs are very strict on products imported into Canada. All products over Canadian $25 are subject to duties and GST or Vat tax. Our invoices are in U.S. dollars, and being converted to Canadian dollars for purpose of duties and taxes, by Canadian Customs.
Here's a link to find the CBSA offices where you can actually go and do the clearance, and save some significant dollars:
http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/do-rb/services/lvs-efv-eng.html
This project is promoted by Jellop , the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $250MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth crowdfunding campaign, and experience is everything. We delivered on our very first campaign late, which was painful experience, but we learned a ton. Since then, we've delivered early on every one. We make conservative estimates and get our numbers and partners straight ahead of time.

With that said, like with any project, there is risk in bringing a new product into the world. It is possible that our reliance on supplier and manufacturing vendors could result in unforeseen delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This game is an action RPG about strengthening the bonds you already have with the friends in your gaming group, or forming new bonds of friendship, in the face of shared adversity and the greatest challenge. Nothing beats the thrill of coming together to defeat a seemingly insurmountable foe. 5TDM doesn't pull any punches. It puts you through the wringer and lets your group emerge closer to each other than ever. It is competitive, but not toxic.
Small groups of player characters are pitted against each other in a no-holds-barred frenzy of carnage in a team-based, player-vs-player competition. 5th Edition Team Deathmatch is a contest of skill, wits, and luck. 5TDM is about winning the world's most popular roleplaying game.
Team Fortress
THIS GAME IS FINISHED! We are running this Kickstarter campaign in order to raise funds for editing, layout, final art, and printing. Backers will receive the fully playable rough draft documents at the very start of the campiagn.
THE GAME IS AMAZING! We've been doing this kind of team deathmatch since 2011, hosting many live tournaments from small shops to the grandeur of GenCon. We are the original auteurs - this Kickstarter will help give us a spotlight on a more grand stage to show you what wonders we've accomplished.
STRETCH GOAL #1 - NEW ARENA BY SERSA VICTORY
At a funding level of $5,000 a secret arena shall be unlocked! We're so damned close!
This will be the TWENTY-FIRST such arena and will be included  in the digital and physical rewards. We will unleash the Tyrant-Lord of  Deathtrap Dungeons himself, none other than Sersa Victory, to design a 5th Edition Team Deathmatch arena! 
EXHIBITION MATCHES
See it in action! Be sure to join us at twitch.tv/defydanger to see a live 5TDM showdown or visit past matches on our YouTube Channel https://bit.ly/2QWQrRQ!
Sunday December 2nd, 6:00pm EST
 Black Candle Games v. DiceMonkey & Gnome Stew 
Playing on Arena: Slaughterhouse 
OUR MISSION
The mission of Defy Danger is to intensify your gaming experience at the table by pushing the boundaries of what is possible in a tabletop roleplaying game. This project takes the feel of platform fighting games, online games, tactical war games, and competitive team vs. team exercises and brings it to the worlds most popular roleplaying game. We have developed a core ruleset with twenty deadly arenas that challenge player and team alike. This product also includes a series of hard-earned tips on character creation, tactics, running tournament, and how to design your own deadly arena.
With your backing, we will deliver a product that will make you rethink what is possible at the table, and fuel the competitive juices within. The design of 5TDM has been put through the fires and is now ready for prime time. You can help us make our dream of this multiplayer RPG game a reality by backing this Kickstarter, allowing us the funds to produce this in a professional way.
Strike The Earth
WHAT YOU GET
This is a 100+ page book with twenty original maps, custom rules for competitive team vs. team play, a strategy guide, a guide to running your own matches, and a guide to running tournaments.
Backers at the Hey Not Too Rough level and above will be contacted individually and given the option of joining an online exhibition match. These singular matches will be friendlies with no trophies or reward at stake besides the sweet taste of glory.
FEATURES
5TDM is inspired by the heart-pounding action of many popular video games and other media franchises put into the form of a new RPG game. Where it elevates beyond the confinements of a video game or board game is the room for creativity and design provided by tabletop roleplaying games. 5TDM also serves as a crucible where you and your closest friends face the utmost trial - a rival adventuring team. This project allows excited referees the tools needed to run their own 5TDM matches, tournaments, and advise on how to start creating new arenas of their own.
The project will deliver:
Introduction to the style of gaming 5TDM heralds
Character creation rules designed to maximize both fun and carnage
Double-page full-color cartography of twenty (20) hellscape arenas of death, along with full page rules. Total. Brutal.
Speaking of arenas, totally gonzo over-the-top locations that bend the existing rules in new and creative ways; for example, an arena of ricochet pinball pseudo-physics
Strategy guidance on each arena
Guidance on running individual matches as well as full-scale tournaments
Instructions on how best to design your own fighting arena
Pre-Generated characters as guidelines for solid deathmatch strategy
Astral Ambush
GAME MECHANICS
5TDM is much more nuanced and challenging than simple one-on-one duels. It requires a deep understanding of the core ruleset, strong teamwork and communication skills, and an unending thirst for blood.
Fast, frantic play is encouraged. Dungeoneers deemed to be stalling, delaying, or in any way slowing the game will be killed at the referee's decree.
Tournaments consist of individual encounters called matches. Each match lasts between 45 to 60 minutes. At the end of every match, the number of dungeoneer deaths will be tallied, and the team with the least number of deaths will be declared the winner. Tournaments typically are ladder bracket style and consist of three different maps that highlight different character features or builds.
Death is not the end in 5TDM. Dead (aka “Gibbed”) player characters respawn to come back in on their next turn to take revenge on their enemies and even the score. It is an unending struggle of violence and pain.
Each player’s turn lasts only a minute or so in real-time. Focus is needed on everyone else’s turn to plan ahead in a constantly shifting tactical environment. Players who dilly-dally and waste time are punished for delaying the game.
Pre-made arenas provide unique situations to afford players tactical opportunities to wreak havoc on other players, or gain boons for themselves and/or their allies. Arenas will each have their own special rules, forcing players to develop a deeper level of strategy in order to take advantage of each map they expect to compete on. 
Pinball Wizard
ARENAS
The heart of 5TDM is the innovative ways it puts forth for teams to do battle.
Slaughterhouse.A two-level meatgrinder full of nailgun turrets and unstoppable conveyors feeding a central pit of serrated blades.
Dead Simple. The no-frills arena, an opportunity to show off true tactical skill in a minimalist setting.
The Citadel. A dread fortress, home to the armory holding the fabled intelligent sword Blackrazor, and an array of powerful siege weaponry.
Run! A never-ending race through trap gauntlets with bizarre doors and portals.
Collapse. Floating above the Elemental Chaos, this icy arena falls apart in the heart of battle, plunging the combatants into the bottomless abyss below.
Retroverse Arcade. Dungeoneers dial it back to the 80's and plunk a few more quarters into the machine. Wakka-wakka-wakka-wakka!
Pinball Wizard. You’re a wizard. A pinball wizard. Grab an extra ball to keep your allies up as you slam tilt your enemies into the great unknown below the flippers.
Dhakaan Hegemony. The battle over the Lost Crown of Tesh-Naga rages eternally over the treasure hoard of Tiamat, the Dragon Goddess of Greed.
Court of the Storm Lord. The stormlord Xann, god of the skies, rules over this windswept temple. Are you strong enough to control the storms and strike down thy foes?
Team Fortress. In a realm of disorder and horror, we find teams of gladiators. They fight over mystical flags, through a red and blue haze of constant reincarnation.
Lethal Conflict. An homage to the fighting games of the early 90s, this arena pits dungeoneers on a mutable 2D stage ready to chop, kick, flip, and stab their enemies. 
Tomb of the Iron Lich. Deep inside the mithril-forged catacombs, Kaldun the Artificer-Paladin Lich pits adventurers against each other in a fight to the death amidst its Souldriver Four-Armed Iron Golem and the dreaded Deck of Mortals.
SMASH. It’s side-scrolling platform mayhem! Jockey over minimal ground, smash each other into the void, and avoid the shifting planar manifestations. 
Death Wyverns Crucible.  Eight slabs of black marble jut from a lake of hissing dracolisk bile that surrounds this vast wrought-iron crucible. Pieces of bone float gingerly on the surface.  A toxic mist hangs around the cages. Winged shadows shriek and circle overhead. 
Ambulatory of Sorrow by Sersa Victory. Deep within the Abyss lairs the Succubus Queen, the most fecund of all demons. Run and slay as fast as you can or be nourishment for her next brood.
Vault of the Spider Queen. They who incubate the dark egg of the underworld gain the blessings of the Demonweb Pits, but at a perilous cost.
Astral Ambush. In the grim darkness of the astral sea, there is only death. Grab a plasma rifle fight the invading boarding party. Don't get sucked into the cold void of space!
Strike The Earth. Deep in the adamantium mines, ride the fast-moving minecart and arm yourself with weapons  of the highest craft-dwarf-ship to win the day ere the werebeasts get hungry.
Mutiny on the Hellstrider by Roving Band of Misfits. Arrr, me mateys! Sail upon the magma sea and fight over control of the HMS Hellstrider!
Terror Core. A hex-based fight crawling on the walls of a radioactive nuclear core meltdown. Random mutations twist players' character sheets in unpredictable, devastating ways.
Slaughterhouse
KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN
5TDM has been in development for several years and has been extensively playtested. To bring this amazing, blood-pumping action to the next level, we need your backing. Your pledges will be used to elevate Team Deathmatch to a real product and the fulfillment of our years-long dreams.
Editing. The game text, including rules for all twenty arenas, is complete. At the completion of the Kickstarter, we will bring Jon Green, author of Edge of the Frontier, as the editor.
Art. Brandon Reinert, artist for titles such as Crush the Rebellion, Eternal Serpent Tower, and The Fortune Teller's Guide to Deathtrap Design, is at the ready to flesh out the nightmare visions of our authors onto the page. This will help us better communicate the fire and fury that is the heart of 5TDM games.
If the game funds, Brandon will be able to complete the art for the book.
Printing. If it funds, the project will be printed as an Executive size style book, with color printing, casewrap binding, 80# paper, and glossy finish, for distribution to backers at the Hurt Me Plenty level and above.
Arenas will also be printed on seperate 11"x17", full color, double-sided cardstock, for distribution to backers at the Ultra-Violence level and above.
Shipping of physical rewards is to Canada and the United States only.
ONLINE TOURNAMENT
If the project funds, we will be able to offer an online tournament of the game at the start of 2019. This will feature up to sixteen (16) teams of four (4) players each, with the winning team earning physical trophies. This is your chance to prove to the world that you and your friends are the best, that you are masters of this game, that luck is on your side, and that fortune favors the bold. This tournament will be recorded and made public via Twitch for the entire world to see and adore. Winners will have their choice of trophy style:
ESPORTS
5th Edition Team Deathmatch is poised to be the forefront of a new and unique way to experience tabletop roleplaying games through eSports. With your help, this Kickstarter can be the spark the lights the fire on a new chapter of RPG games online. We at Defy Danger are already in plans to take 5TDM into the realm of competitive eSports with additional tournaments and other sanctioned events. This is a major watershed moment in tabletop RPGs and your chance to catch the wave early.
This is also the moment where we decide the discourse of this medium as the shining point of light standing against the toxic elements of this realm. 5TDM pledges to be the premier example of good sportsmanship and welcoming inclusiveness in eSports.
FUTURE SUPPLEMENTS
After the initial wave of activity of the Kickstarter, Defy Danger plans on releasing additional developed arenas that did not make the first cut for the book. Keep an eye out for an arena expansion pack, to include some classic deathmatch arenas such as Tower of Babel, and new arenas currently in development!

Hi, Hello, and Hooray! Dear Reader,
The Forest Hymn & Picnic is a forthcoming tabletop adventure game set across the backdrop of a very absurd, unending and often haunted forest. Players take up the lives of oddballs in The Forest Hymn—precocious Animal Folk, lost People, or costumed Ghosts—as they stumble upon trouble in the strange woods. Take on work in town and get to know the neighbors, investigate the supernatural, take a spot in the brass band, explore the ruins that litter the woods or even win a dance marathon at the county fair! This role playing game is best played in 2 to 4 hour sessions by folks ages 13 and up.
This RPG is heavily inspired by the following sweethearts:
The illustrations and literary works of Arnold Lobel: Frog & Toad, etcetera
 The Wind In The Willows by Kenneth Grahame
The more outlandish bits of the 100 Acre Wood as told by A. A. Milne 
 Over The Garden Wall by Patrick McHale
A certain animated film from 1949 based on Washington Irving's The Legend Of Sleepy Hollow 
 The Skeleton Dance by Ub Iwerks—specifically the 1929 version in both black and white!
Stories allegedly told by the Greek fabulist Aesop 
The music of The Decemberists 
Click this fine picnicker to read about the types of Forest Dwellers and make your own adventurer!
Between its pages, The Forest Hymn & Picnic runs a heavily modified version of the very well loved, very brilliantly engineered system from Robert J. Schwalb's Shadow of the Demon Lord. It's a set of rules that champions ease of use, simple maths, and a progression system that gives players a near endless supply of options in creating unique characters through the course of play. The Forest Hymn & Picnic keeps all of that in its pocket while making the changes needed to fit this setting—simplified magic, abstract wealth, and new inventory rules are some of the biggest changes.
You don't need to have read or own SotDL to play in The Forest Hymn. This is a complete game all in a single book! Here are a few things you'll find:
 Unique adventurer personalities: players use personality tables to stack the building blocks of their odd adventurers before making them their own. Play a Frog who constantly loses his shoes and loves to gamble, a Person who was raised by wolves and wants to win a pie eating contest, or a Ghost who plays the trumpet and is full of hard candies!
 Episodic play with milestone leveling-up: at-the-table gameplay focuses on the adventure or story at hand but time passes in woods. After each session, adventurers level up and players make choices that tell the story of their forest dweller's life between adventures. Take up as a fortune teller's apprentice and learn a magic trick or two or even waste your days and pennies away as a rakehell, bothering people for the sheer fun of it. The Forest Hymn & Picnic plays well as one-shots or as a campaign of ten sessions.
 Simple dice mechanic: whenever the outcome of a player's action is murky and unknowable, roll a single twenty sided die, add a simple modifier and any d6 gifts or d6 gags you have from your good—or bad!—grades. The results help tell a story of the very good times or a very bad, no-good horrible day.
 Seasonal magic tricks: magic works in odd ways in The Forest Hymn and the time of year in the woods effects how magic works. Keeping track of an adventurer's tricks is as simple as knowing what season it is. A spell that lets an adventurer grow three times their size might work beautifully in the spring but in autumn it might shrink them to a third of their size!
 A menagerie of games to play: minigames pepper the game's rules, allowing narrators to quickly resolve broader actions such as telling spooky stories, fishing, sack races, dance marathons and much more. These minigames give players and narrators opportunities to pause their shenanigans in town and getting lost in the woods to try out something a little different.
Check out the character sheet, in both Fine Black & White and Fancy Printer Destroying versions! Here is an example sheet, filled out. I spelled sandwiches wrong because that's what my character would do. The blank spot on the back of the sheet provides ample room to jot down notes, doodle pictures, or record your backstory.
If you were to hop in a pedal-powered balloon for a lazy afternoon tour of The Forest Hymn, you'd look out and see nothing but trees from one edge of the horizon to the other. Occasionally a hill peppered with small hamlets and farms would rise above the greenery like a lump in a warm quilt. From your balloon you might spy the busy forest dwellers scurrying and getting their day's affairs in order. You might spot them spreading blankets on the ground and unpacking baskets of tea and sandwiches, haggling over the penny cost of some overlarge vegetable or even see them dancing around the maypole.
However, if you instead go for a walk in the woods rather than flying above it you'd see no end of absurdity, including:
 Wisps stalking the scene of a pie cooling in a window.
Forest dwellers searching by lantern for children lost in the woods.
Ruined places haunted by monsters and hiding rare treasures.
Witches zooming over the ever-dangerous Spookwood looking for rare flowers.
Skeleton bands practicing their funeral numbers in long abandoned cemeteries.
The Stork, drunk and trying to convince some forest dweller to take in an orphaned child.
Boarding homes teeming with adventurers, song, and dance.
 Candy shoppes, fairs, maypoles, corn mazes, haunted mansions, magic tricks, bad weather, good weather and more!
Click the spooky tree to read more about The Spookwood and make your own Monsters!
Dearest reader this brings us to the most important thing, the reason I've brought The Forest Hymn & Picnic to Kickstarter. This game needs a warm blanket to wrap itself in! Specifically it needs to be printed on 208 pages of thick, 70# uncoated paper in full color and tucked into a 6x9 cover of black pearl linen and stamped with white/silver foil. But that costs money, and so do the artists. So help me raise the funds for paying these very talented, young, good looking and fast running people to help me make the book!
For this book, I will be painting backgrounds and environments in mixed mediums and handing them off to Sam and Casey to decorate in their own styles to give the book an old cartoon feel. The process looks something like this:
No good fiction about forests comes without a song or two to hum when you're lost and Gabe Soria—a writer of many good fictions—has contributed a song to the beginning of each chapter. Some songs might even come with a score! For example, here is The Birthing Day song arranged for pots and pans and broken bottles.
By now you've probably had a gander at the backer levels offered at this project. Here is some import things to know about shipping:
 All backers at $15 USD or more will receive stretch goals! Yay!
 Digital goods, including any unlocked stretch goals will be delivered via DriveThruRPG. You'll get a survey at the end of the asking for the email address you would like to use for this.
 Shipping will be collected separately. You will receive an email that will take you to a store front where you can put in your address, and pay the appropriate shipping cost. Again, shipping costs for printed books is separate from your pledge level. Inside the United States you can expect shipping to cost anywhere from 3 to 6 US dollars for Media Mail. We'll make sure your book is snuggled up.
 International fulfillment will be handled by our friends at the Melsonian Arts Council. Daniel has an excellent track record when it comes to not only running successful Kickstarter campaigns, but shipping on time. CONE will eat the cost of freighting overseas books to Daniel in bulk. This should ease the cost usually associated with international shipping. Because of transit times, international backers will be receiving their books a bit later. Backers will get a choice to receive their books from Nashville, TN or London, UK.
In these trying times of galactic trade wars an uncertain port blockades, I only ask that international backers exercise patience.
This Kickstarter will pay for a very limited print run of 1500 books. There are exactly 1,000 books available through this campaign. I'll be holding on to the remaining books to account for transit damages, lost books and other disasters, contributor, press, and one for my mom copies. After the dust settles any remaining inventory will go up for sale.
The Forest Hymn & Picnic is written and decorated by me, Cecil Howe; artist, creator and co-designer of the Gold ENnie Award winning Hex Kit as well as the writer and illustrator of 2016's survival misery simulator Do Not Let Us Die In The Dark Night Of This Cold Winter. He'll be joined by fresh-faced artist Casey Cookson and industry veteran Sam Mameli, SotDL editor and proofreader Jay Spight with contributions from novel and graphic novel author, and all-around hero, Gabe Soria. In addition to those suckers, game design geniuses Robert J. Schwalb and Brad Murray will be or have already been forced to consult on this project.
This game couldn't happen without the love, support, occasional nay-saying, and advice of the RPG Talk family. Or the darlings that hang out in the Kill 6 Billion Demons Patreon discord.
A long form pitch, random sights in The Forest Hymn, and closer look at People, Animal Folk, and Ghosts can all be found at https://www.theforesthymn.com.
Table Top Babble host James Introcaso was gracious enough to have me on Episode #90 of their great podcast, where I talk at length about The Forest Hymn & Picnic. You can find it here: https://dontsplitthepodcastnetwork.com/table-top-babble/090.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Life finds a way, a way to break as many things as possible. To soften whatever blow that might come up I've set my aims on an end'o'January release but hope to make this happen sooner than that. The game is written and is in the process of being fine tuned and made ready to go to the editor, nearly every chapter song is written, and the artists are simply waiting for me to prove I have the cash to pay them to get to work.

That being said, the biggest risk to this project is a breakdown in shipping. I tried to find a states-based printer willing to work with me on price and materials to get the book I want but in the end the printer I chose is located in Canada. They have an A+ track record, including printing several RPG books, and have kept the retail price of this book from crossing 60 USD. But the future of trade agreements is murky, and there might be hiccups at customs as a result. Rest assured I am watching carefully and leaving room to breathe.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Face Unknown Horrors! 
You stand on the brink of the Apocalypse. The Demon Lord, an entity of incalculable power blights the lands with cursed evil, madness and slaughter. The dreadful beings let loose by the Demon Lord reflects this being’s nightmarish essence, the touch of its shadow and its insatiable hunger for all things. 
Although the Demon Lord remains outside the mortal view, every new horror connected to him arises from the dirt and bring destruction and new death, also weakening little by little his planar prison, unchaining the constraints that are preventing him to escape the Void and bring catastrophic destruction to the world.
Robert Schwalb create a world facing the total annihilation, its lands torn asunder by war, plague, and ancient horrors. Urth, the world of Shadow of the Demon Lord, is one of many imperiled by the shadowy menace lurking without and in this game you can play through its final days as embattled survivors fighting against what to many seems to be an inevitable end. 
A complete role playing game in one book, Shadow of the Demon Lord contains everything you need to create characters to confront the hordes of demons spilling in from the Void and to create and play through exciting stories steeped in horror and violence. To make this happen, the game system is easy to learn, plays fast, and requires little preparation to play. All these ensure both novice and veteran players can enjoy the game together. The benefit of short campaigns lets you tell more stories, create more characters, and experience more of the game's options than other game before. As a player, you are encouraged to play several heroes, trying the potential of the path’s engine to create incredible flexible characters. And, as a Game Master, you can run a complete campaign in lesser time than usual, introducing new ideas, places and horrors every time. 
The horror is perfect when is narrated in short stories, full of madness and fear. These are the only stories that thrive you at night and remain in your memories for long time.
BlackStar is a whole new game line based on Shadow of the Demon Lord RPG, originally designed and created by Robert Schwalb. Death & Decay, our first release, will depict and introduce new monsters and develop exciting new ways to add fun and terror to the creatures you already know. It will be an immersive, dark fantasy supplement, that gives players and GMs alike new resources for their gaming sessions. 
You will find plenty of undead out there ready to drain your last breath, coming from the Underworld itself or from the haunting darker places scattered through Urth.
The Creature Codex will be a 128 pages book that describes monsters of undeath, creatures of decay and lurking horrors. It presents many classical monsters revisited with new game options that can bring new excitement to your sessions, as well as plenty of new undead monsters of all types.
Following are some of the unique features introduced in Death & Decay:
• Presences: Infested dolls, whispers in the night, echoes of battles, doomed crypts and ghost ships! All of these entities can be found all around Urth. Infestations, apparitions, geists and malevolentes, all can be suppressed or banished forever. The task can be easy or hard, but presences might damn you for life. They can come back with renewed strength to drag you to the grave, corrupt your soul or lure you to the edge of insanity. Destroying them or survive can be the goal of an entire campaign. Death can be the minor evil. 
• Spirits: Spirits or incorporeal undead are a simple form of monsters that cannot follow the cycle of life and death on Urth. They nurture the evil in others and feed on the anguish they create in their victims, the sorrow they cause, the evil they plant, all to feed the Demon Lord and unchain him. Spectral beings and ghosts, shadows in the mists or wraiths can appear everywhere, in lost cairns or abandoned tombs, in attics or cellars, in ancient forests or in the crypt of an important church to carry victims with them and bring, as well, survivors to death in a slow agony for the madness they caused. Spirits alter the land they haunt, so be aware that banish a tortured soul from the living world can be the most terrific experience you may have in your entire life. 
• Corpses: Animated corpses, zombies, bone constructs, risen and others corporeal beings are the flesh of the hate that the demon lord feel toward the worlds of the livings. This contaminated corpses are risen by his foul cultists to generate waves of destruction, or they rise up by themselves to claim vengeance upon the mortals. Whatever the case, they are unstoppable, and their force can grow more than you can imagine in hordes capable of spread death and burning evil behind them.
• Nightmares: Not sure if they are undead or dead at all, nightmares are the immortal visions of thousand mad minds and foul dreamers. A nightmare created lives in a limbo of nonexistence. However, their corruption and insanity can open the gates, and they will haunt dreams during the night; pervade the mind of anyone corrupted or mad so to overwhelm him by supernatural horrors. That said, be aware that your corrupted soul can strive you more than you have imagined until now.  
And if you want more, be sure to support Death & Decay campaign. With your help, more creepy things will rise from the Void in Death & Decay, new forms of undead never seen before. We will investigate through the nature of Urth to find plants, malefic fungi and vermins that can cause decay to the living, or supernatural horrors from the Underworld and the Void. And of course, new players and GMs supplements, villains and adventures, and so on.
After the initial goal is funded, here you will find a scheme of the backer levels with everything included in each pledge to easy understand what everyone will earn from the campaign.
       Who is behind the veil of darkness?
Robert J. Schwalb is the mind behind Shadow of the Demon Lord RPG, and he wrote dozens of your favorite roleplaying game for many years, from Dungeon & Dragons to Warhammer. In Death&Decay he will be our Deus Ex machina and, as The Oversee Eye, he will grant to you the best game supplement for his game! (www.schwalbentertainment.com).
Dave Harrison brings over 30 years of GMing experience to the project. Ten years of that has involved coordinating the (undead) legions of organised play volunteers and conventions. He has been an editor and writer for a number of gaming products (Conflict, Fading Suns, Dark Sun, Pathfinder) and will also take care of language and style for Death & Decay. He has a morbid fascination with the grim and dark arts of the necromancer.
Bruce is a senior and award-winning game designer. He worked on D&D over the course of 4 editions as a writer and developer, with well over one hundred credits, including Return to the Tomb of Horrors, Expanded Psionics Handbook, Gamma World, and the D&D 5th Edition corebooks. On the design team at MCG, he’s worked on The Strange, Numenera products like Into the Outside and Jade Colossus, Cypher System books like Gods of the Fall, and of course Numenera Discovery and Numenera Destiny, to name just a few. He’s also a novel author with ten major publications to his name, including Myth of the Maker, as well as several books set in the Forgotten Realms, including the Abolethic Sovereignty trilogy, the Sword of the Gods duology, Stardeep, Darkvision, and more.
Sean is a very famous designer and developer. After finishing his chemistry degree he took a radical left turn and started working in the game industry. He’s been a webmaster, game designer, developer, freelancer-wrangler, and many other jobs that can’t be described in one or two words. He’s worked on a couple hundred books for a half a dozen RPGs (including Numenera and three editions of D&D), designed videogames, taught classes on game design, written plays and musicals, run online game conventions, judged international talent-search contests, and had bit parts in geeky movies like Gamers: Dorkness Rising and Attacking the Darkness. He draws, paints, and sings with moderate skill, and is passionate about helping people and introducing others to the wonders of gaming. He lives in a haunted building in Seattle, Washington with his cats.
The lead game designer team of WMS Publishing will be the BlackStar who will guide you through this journey. Experienced game designers, writers, editors and gamers in over 20 years they’ve helped to rise and shine dozens of titles in Italy as a team who prefers to show instead of tell. (Discover)
Hydra Team is a group of writers, editors, proofreaders, artists, graphic designers and consultants working in the game industry. We are all about fostering game literacy in its true meaning: as an enjoyable and educational tool. Hydra Team specializes in high quality and imaginative game projects, balancing strong artistic and creative talents over a more business-focused approach. (www.hydrateamgames.com).
Katerina is the first of our young and talented artist, who will make this project shine! She has a passion for old literature of 1800 and ’80. She loves Lynch and Cronenberg and videogames (more for the arts than for actual play). She is inspired by Giger and Bilal and by the darkest side of the human heart. She is our cover artist and will be our lead artist. (www.artstation.com/adrenochrome)
Melissa, known as Reddraws on internet, mermaid obsessed, karate teacher and tea lover, is a freelance illustrator, concept artist and comics book artist. She works with Wyrd Edizioni, Potato KIller Studios, Darkslinger Comics, NUpress and others, as illustrator and concept artist, and worked as miniature artist for Kabuki Studios. In 2018 has been selected for 'Infected By Art', and every year live paints on Area Performance in Lucca C&G. She loves to paint for herself original pieces too! (Reddraws/FB , Melissa Spandri\Instagram )
Andrea Guardino is a Freelance Illustrator/Character Designer born in 1988. He works in Milan, as Freelance Artist and Concept Artist, Character Designer and Illustrator for Wyrd Edizioni and others. Since 2010 he is in The Evil Company, he co-founded, a group of artists and authors ("Roll Again" and "The Take Five" comics are some of their works). He is also Character Designer/Illustrator for "Ventura", an online RPG. He is also a miniature Concept Artist for ClockWork Paladin Miniatures and member of Dicegames Italia (a group of Youtubers and artists whose aim is to spread the RPGs to the public). See his works here.
And other creepy beings will be revelead during the campaign.
We are going to be charging shipping separately later when the books are almost ready. It will be USA-, EU-, Canada-, and Australia-friendly. As the production will be european we try to keep it simple, but international shipping can be heavy for a small company. Shipping rates can also rise after a campaign ends but before the games are ready to ship. So, about a month from shipping, we will assess and collect actual shipping costs. The upside is that you don’t need to pay the full cost now. We also want to point out that we will try to sell BlackStar Death & Decay through distribution and into game and book stores after backers get their books. The Kickstarter will not be the only way you can get the book. However your contribute will be fundamental to obtain it. 
You can see now the estimated costs in the Update #24
Blackstar Games: BlackStar Games is the new international label from WMS Publishing, licensee of Robert Schwalb’ Shadow of the Demon Lord RPG line. We apply our passion and creativity to bring you whole new levels of imagination. We believe RPGs are a way to forge together creativity, art and design to create a new form of communication. You can visit our facebook Page: BlackStar Games and our site pages on www.hbdragongames.
Schwalb Entertainment: Schwalb Entertainment, LLC was founded in 2014 by Robert J. Schwalb (veteran RPG game designer and developer, and author) to offer a rich, immersive game-play experience in worlds of dark fantasy and science fiction, most notably, the horror fantasy roleplaying game, Shadow of the Demon Lord. Before Schwalb Entertainment, Robert was a member of the 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons design team, worked as a developer for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 2nd Edition, and was lead designer on A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying. He has contributed design to a slew of D&D sourcebooks, supplements for the d20 system, the Cypher System, and many other roleplaying games. Schwalb Entertainment, LLC is headquartered in Murfreesboro, Tennessee. Questions? Contact Schwalb Entertainment at info@schwalbentertainment.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are a business company with 10 years of experience and RPGs are our passion. This is our first international product, done with our collegue and friend Robert J. Schwalb, that trust us non only as his partner for the localization of his Shadow of the Demon Lord, but also for develop new official things. At this point it's a matter of adding any extra material unlocked by stretch goals, commissioning the remaining art, and the doing the graphic design and layout. These are not trivial tasks but they are comfortably in our wheelhouse. The only real risk is one that confronts every RPG: lateness. This can happen on any project with a lot of moving parts but we are already well ahead of the game.

updates.update_content:
This is a most anticipated update about the Italian release. 
Welcome Italian friends to a world of suffering...

Hello all!
we have good news. The second book, Grimlore, is done and you will receive today an email from Drivethrurpg to download it. 
What is Grimlore about ?

Grimlore!
We’re happy to confirm the book is ready, completed, and revised. We are fixing the last issues, and it should be finished this week. Then we will release the PDF for you. We hope you enjoy it. With this book, you will have four new creatures for each of the nine entries, to transform your deadly one-shot adventures into even more deadly adventures. In addition, you will find more ideas for adventurers that will ease your job as GMs.

Hello all!
Thanks for your patience and support!
Grimlore is in editing! We hope to receive files soon. Arts and other elements of the book are complete. 
In the meantime we are working on the third book: Secrets of the Grave, a collection of adventures focused on our monsters that you can easily adapt to all levels. We are also commissioning new arts and maps for this supplement.

Grimlore
Grimlore's writing is near completion and will be sent to our editors very soon. In this supplement, you will find new ideas for ghosts, specters, shadows, wights, golems, and other undead. Descriptions, statistics, options, and ideas will allow you to immediately insert them into your gaming sessions or use them as references to create new antagonists. There will be gardens of shadow plants seeking new lives to drain, lost souls of bloodthirsty regents who still reign in the heart of their abandoned headquarters, bog mummies awakening in the marshes to command a new legion of zombie, golems created with the remains of legendary creatures, and vampires that feed upon jungle animals revered as gods by beastmen. Over 36 new creatures await you to animate your Shadow of the Demon Lord adventures.

here a quick update about Creature Codex and about what we are doing just now.
Creature Codex: We are waiting more backers to download their copy, as we would like that all of you had the opportunity to read and give us feedback. Many of you sent us their suggestions and we want to thank you all - your contribution is very precious.

campaign.story:
We hit 100% and all of the stretch goals! Thank you so much!
EVERY physical copy of Video Games and Pizza Parties will now come with the following:
(Scroll down to see unlocked stretch goal rewards!)
Hi! I'm Sarah Graley and I'm the creator of Our Super Adventure, a diary webcomic about living with four cats and a cat-like boy! I love drawing the moments in life that make my heart go mushy, and the moments that make me laugh! You can read some of my diary comics over at Webtoon!

I also write and draw comics like Kim Reaper & Rick and Morty: Lil' Poopy Superstar for Oni Press, and Glitch for Scholastic Graphix (out in 2019!).
Back in 2015, I ran a successful Kickstarter for the first Our Super Adventure hardback collection, and now I'm back to to ask for your help to kickstart the second hardback collection: Our Super Adventure: Video Games and Pizza Parties!
The goal of this project is to fund a beautiful full colour hardback collection of 200 comics drawn over the past three years, which have never been in print before! Around a third of the comics will be book-exclusive too! 
This time I want to make the book better than ever with a really nice printed cloth spine! It's going to the best Our Super Adventure book so far and I need you to help me to make it happen!
Our Super Adventure is a diary comic all about me, Sarah, and my everyday life with my partner, Stef, and our four cats - Pesto, Toby, Wilson and Pixel! We joke about a whole bunch with one another and we've got a shared love of videogames, music and pizza! 
I started making these comics as a way of keeping track of various sweet or funny moments that happened, and since starting to post them online five years ago, they seem to have found their way to so many other people who have had similar sweet moments in their own lives and relationships! 
We always thought we were kinda silly - we're definitely in the adult phase of our lives but at the same time we don't really feel like adults - but after hundreds of conversations with like-minded people at comic conventions and online, maybe we're all a little bit silly in the same way?
Our cats are a massive part of our lives, and naturally they're a huge part of the comics as well! We've had four cats for the last four years, and we love them all so, so much. If we're ever having a quiet moment, normally it doesn't take long for one of them to track us down and hang out with us. (If they aren't too busy causing trouble with each other of course!) 
In the last three years since I kickstarted Our Super Adventure, we've travelled out to numerous overseas comic conventions, moved house, and we've even started working together! Even more recently, we made another big leap of sorts too: 
So here we are! Almost three years to the day that I started the Kickstarter for Our Super Adventure, we're here to try and get a really lovely 2nd collection together, collecting Our Super Adventure comics from 2015-2018. We're calling it Our Super Adventure: Video Games and Pizza Parties. 
For this Kickstarter project, we want to collect all of the Our Super Adventure strips posted online between 2015 and 2018 (except for the Our Super American Adventure ones, they've got their own book already!), and combine those with over 60 brand new never-been-online comics to make another collection of 200 Our Super Adventure comics! 
This time around we want to make a really special first edition print run of the book. We're looking at getting the book made with a printed cloth spine, and it's going to look incredible!
We're also going to try and put in some extra features too - we've got ideas for some bonus stretch goal pages involving the cats, photo collages of what we've been up to since the first book came out, and maybe even getting Stef to draw and colour a whole Our Super Adventure comic! 
We love making these physical comic collections - we really like the idea that in an age where comics can be found and read online so easily, the physical book should be as nice as it can be! With my first Kickstarter back in 2015, I got to make a really nice 200 page hardback book for Our Super Adventure, and it literally wouldn't have happened without the wonderful support of all of the Kickstarter backers on that project!
So, we're back on Kickstarter for Our Super Adventure: Video Games and Pizza Parties, because we want to make this collection as nice it as can be, and we totally need your help to make it happen!
We also want to make some other Kickstarter exclusive things, like signed and sketched bookplates, new enamel pins, and t-shirts too!
The Our Super Adventure: Video Games and Pizza Parties 1st Edition book will be a square 16.5 x 16.5cm (inside pages 15.5 x 15.5cm) hardback with a printed yellow cloth spine. It's a book finish we've seen a few times and we've always been really impressed by how nice it looks - we're really looking forward to getting to see these books in person!

The book will contain 200 Our Super Adventure comic strips - That's all the comics posted online between 2015 and 2018 (except for the Our Super American Adventure comics which have their own book already!), and around 60 Our Super Adventure comics which are book exclusive! The book should be around 224 pages long. 
The book will be full colour, and we've gone back and relettered some of the earlier strips so everything looks super nice and consistent! I also redrew some of the earlier comics too - I was just getting used to my new setup at the time and some of the colours and art looked a bit weird. These original versions will live on forever online, but I wanted to make sure that everything in the book looked as good as it could be! 
All books will be signed!
The bookplate is something a bit more special for your book! This is an 8cm x 11cm bookplate that will be signed, personalised and sketched on, and then stuck into the front of the book! If you want the personal touch, this is the reward for you! 
I love making hard enamel pins, and I've designed a special set for this Kickstarter - a gold and white Our Super Adventure speech bubble pin, and a gold and black Toby pin! 
This Kickstarter-exclusive t-shirt design is the first 3 colour screen print t-shirt that I've ever designed! We're using Gildan Softstyle t-shirts, they're lightweight and good quality! (Sizes available - Unisex S - 3XL) 
If you don't already have the first Our Super Adventure book, you can totally get it as part of this Kickstarter campaign too! Both books are the same size, so they should look great on a shelf together. This book features 200 Our Super Adventure strips as well, in a hardback book with gold foiling detail on the cover. 
LIMITED SPACES - ALL SPACES FULL
For this special reward, I'll draw you your own Our Super Adventure comic strip! It can feature you, your loved ones, your pets, whoever you like! You can tell me what you want to happen in the four panels, and I'll make it happen!
I do all my art digitally, so I'll send you both the finished digital file, and also print it and send it to you as well!
